title: Technical Sales Specialist
description:
**JOB SUMMARY**  

Establish and maintain effective customer relationships through sales calls at assigned customers. Promote the capabilities of the Automation Group through represented manufacturer’s products and Cross Branded Solutions, then deliver these solutions to solve customer problems. Proactively promote solutions to solve customer problems by applying the appropriate robotic, motion control, automation and/or pneumatic technologies. Responsible for growing sales by nurturing existing business, identifying new business opportunities at existing customers, and generating new sales at target customers. **ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS*** Meet annual sales goals as established by the Sales Manager.
* Grow overall sales and income at existing customers.
* Develop new business opportunities with existing customers and new prospects.
* Develop strong relationships at all assigned customers.
* Maintain CRM for current customers and potential prospects. Track opportunities in CRM sales funnel.
* Adhere to the Cross CRM Netsuite TSS Requirements Guide to manage tools relevant to sales growth achievement.
* Maintain superior technical knowledge of our products. Attend factory training as needed. Develop good working relationships with our Principal manufacturers.
* Integrate Technical Sales Specialist role into Cross team selling approach partnering with Application Engineers, CSRs, and Business Development.
 **ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES*** Communicate all significant customer and supplier issues to Sales Manager.
* Maintain updated and accurate contact lists in CRM tool. Maintain new prospects in CRM. Input customer opportunities inside the CRM.
* Maintain sales call reporting and customer sales related activity in CRM tool.
* Maintain quote activity in CRM. Proficiency in this system is strategic to both Company strategy for customer growth and customer data analysis.
* Have strong knowledge of your competition. Be aware of the strengths and weaknesses of competitive distributors and their products represented in common customer geography.
* Contribute to the Cross Company content creation process. This requirement is directed by the Sales Manager and includes interaction with Marketing for blogs, videos, and application successes.
* Complete any other duties as assigned by Sales Manager. This may include customer related tasks, projects management, or miscellaneous tasks as directed.
 **EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE*** Education/Experience
	+ 5 years industry-related outside sales experience.
	+ BS degree with strong technical content required.
* Knowledge Required
	+ Good mechanical aptitude.
	+ Business acumen to advance organizational goals, based on relevant discrete manufacturing market and trends.
	+ Excellent problem solving skills. Decisively identify action plan required for customer issues.
	+ Outstanding product expertise for each Automation Group technology, including robotics, motion control, automation and pneumatics.
	+ Superior knowledge and practice of basic selling skills.
	+ Strong PC skills using MS Word, Excel PowerPoint, Google business tools and basic CAD.
 **REQUIRED FUNCTIONAL COMPETENCIES*** Adapts to Change & Manager Ambiguity - Operating effectively, even when things are not certain or the way forward is not clear. Effectively adapts to change with a positive attitude.
* Communicates Effectively - Developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences.
* Customer Focus - Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions.
* Ensures Accountability - Holding self and others accountable to meet commitments.
* Servant Leadership - Exhibits the traits of honesty, integrity, mutual respect and ethical conduct. Has the skill of influencing/inspiring people to work toward the common good by demonstrating the specific character qualities of Servant Leadership: Patience, Kindness, Humility, Selflessness, and Honesty.
* Functional/Technical – possesses required skill set to do his/her job at high level of accomplishment.
 **PHYSICAL & MENTAL REQUIREMENTS*** Physical ability to navigate and visit industrial manufacturing environments
* Physical ability to drive long distances
* Overnight travel is possible
* Public speaking in small or large group settings
 **DISCLAIMER**  

The job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise; employment in this job is an “at will” employment relationship.  

 Please note - this position covers Northern Alabama, Eastern Tennessee, as well as northern Georgia.

title: Partner Sales Engineer
description:
**Partner Sales Engineer**
**Delivering Growth!**
Delivering growth for marketers is what NaviStone is all about. For B2C brands in considered-purchase verticals, we deliver proven, time-tested results. The NaviStone platform empowers marketers by finding, activating, and converting lucrative audiences, with incredible impact!
  

**The Challenge**  

NaviStone is on a mission! We’re moving fast, doubling the size of our business over the next 2 years. Our Growth team is rapidly expanding our footprint and we are hiring a new **Partner Sales Engineer** who will support and collaborate with NaviStone’s Enterprise Partner, Client Services, and Business Development leaders to achieve target partner revenue objectives.
**What You'll Do**
* Working closely with the VP Growth, Enterprise Partners, ensure partner revenue objectives are achieved by successfully onboarding partner clients, executing partner client projects, and ensuring partner client projects continue and expand.
* Establish a trusted/strategic advisor relationship with defined NaviStone partners and work with their business development and technical project leads.
* Develop deep expertise in our product and technology to provide support throughout the partners’, and their clients’, journey.
* Be responsible for analyzing NaviStone program results to proactively provide strategic insights and data-driven recommendations including but not limited to ongoing rollout strategy, program tactics, and program adjustments for your defined partners to achieve target program KPIs.
* Monitor and manage NaviStone programs to client budget, analyzing partners’ client performance metrics and providing regular reports and recommendations to key stakeholders.
* Work closely with internal teams to launch new partner client programs and execute marketing strategies.
* Work with the VP Growth Enterprise Partners to accurately forecast and track client revenue on a weekly basis.
* Be a point of contact for the partner when technical issues related to delivering products or services arise, working with NaviStone Operations to ensure smooth delivery and partner satisfaction.
* Support partnership leads in formal program review meetings with the partner
* Develop relationships with co-workers, leadership, and key stakeholders and possess the communication skills and confidence to deliver technical information to non-technical audiences, tying analysis back to core business strategy.


**What You Will Need to Succeed**
* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, advertising, business, or a related field
* 3-5+ years of proven experience in media planning and strategy, preferably in partnership or sales-focused roles
* Strong analytical skills and proficiency in using data analysis tools (PowerBI, Tableau, etc)
* Analytical and data-driven problem solver
* Experience with CRM platforms like HubSpot
* Strong Microsoft Office Skills, including Excel and PowerPoint
* Demonstrated relationship-building with business and technical
* Strong in-person and remote communication and presentation skills
* Motivated by a collaborative work environment
* Exceptional organization skills
* A Proven self-starter in an entrepreneurial environment
* You can travel as needed for client visits


**Develop your best you, and reinvigorate for what’s next**  

*NaviStone’s benefits, programs, and perks are purpose-built to help you grow stronger professionally, and personally. We offer generous medical, dental, vision, and retirement benefits for you and your family.*  

  

*We never stop growing, and we never stop learning. Want to explore AI? Develop new coding skills? Become a better presenter? Grow your leadership skills? Learn advanced yoga? We offer countless professional and personal development opportunities to fuel your ambitions.*  

  

*We’re a Rocketship, but even Rocketships need rest! We work hard, and we go fast. But we also recharge! With unlimited vacation, a generous number of paid holidays, and fun employee events throughout the year, you can refuel and reinvigorate for the incredible journey ahead!*

title: Pre-Sales Engineer
description:
**Job Title: Pre-Sales Engineer - Enterprise Solutions**

**Company: DTech Apps by Discover Technologies**

**Location:**

* Open to remote candidates
* Occasional travel to client sites and for team meetings as required

**Overview:**

DTech Apps by Discover Technologies is seeking a skilled Pre-Sales Engineer to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be pivotal in driving the success of our enterprise products developed on the ServiceNow platform. By leveraging your technical expertise and communication skills, you will work closely with our sales team to understand client needs, demonstrate our product capabilities, and design solutions that meet their business objectives.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Collaborate with the sales team to identify customer requirements and tailor solutions that leverage our ServiceNow enterprise products to meet these needs.
* Conduct detailed product demonstrations and presentations to customers, highlighting the benefits and features of our solutions.
* Engage with customers to understand their business processes and challenges, proposing solutions that enhance their operations through the capabilities of ServiceNow.
* Develop technical proposals and presentations that clearly communicate the value proposition and technical advantages of our solutions.
* Lead the technical aspect of the sales process, answering inquiries, and addressing concerns related to our ServiceNow products.
* Facilitate Proof of Concept (PoC) implementations, showcasing the effectiveness and efficiency of our solutions in a real-world setting.
* Act as a liaison between the sales and product development teams, providing insights from the field to help guide product enhancements and innovations.
* Keep abreast of the latest ServiceNow features and industry trends, ensuring our solutions remain competitive and relevant.
* Support marketing efforts by participating in trade shows, webinars, and other promotional activities.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* 3+ years of experience in a pre-sales engineer role, ideally with a focus on ServiceNow or similar enterprise platform solutions.
* In-depth knowledge of the ServiceNow platform, including its capabilities, configurations, and integrations.
* Exceptional presentation and communication skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a consultative approach to solution selling.
* Experience in IT Service Management (ITSM), IT Operations Management (ITOM), or Enterprise Service Management (ESM) is highly desirable.
* ServiceNow certifications such as Certified System Administrator (CSA) or Certified Implementation Specialist (CIS) are a plus.

**Skills:**

* Proficient in delivering compelling product demonstrations and presentations.
* Ability to work effectively in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
* Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships with clients and stakeholders.
* Keen attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.
* Willingness to travel as needed to support sales and marketing activities.

**Why Join Us?**

DTech Apps by Discover Technologies is at the forefront of developing innovative enterprise solutions on the ServiceNow platform. We offer a collaborative and inclusive work environment where your contributions are valued and celebrated. Our team is dedicated to professional growth and development, offering ample opportunities for advancement. We provide competitive compensation packages, comprehensive benefits, and a flexible work schedule to support work-life balance.

*DTech Apps by Discover Technologies is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an inclusive company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $120,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) 4% Match
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance
* Work from home

Compensation package:

* Bonus opportunities
* Commission pay

Work Location: Remote

title: Web & Mobile Technical Sales Rep (Inbound+Outbound)
description:
Our Web & Mobile Technical Sales Rep is responsible for fielding inbound sales leads and cultivating outbound leads to find potential customers interested in custom websites, web-applications, and mobile apps.

This is a client facing role.

This is a fully remote, full time position.

**What you’ll do:**

* Field inbound sales leads
* Follow up and stay on potential customers you need responses or information from
* Work with our internal experts to gather the needed information and format them into sales quotes and proposals
* Come up with creative solutions on how to present and structure projects and sell to customers
* Keeping our sales CRM up to date for your sales leads

**About Us**

Applied Imagination is a web consulting, design, and development agency based in Atlanta, Georgia. We are a team of innovative and creative thinkers who build amazing things. Our clients ask us to translate complex ideas into simple solutions that make life better and grow businesses. Founded out of a love of building, each one of us is passionate about creating great digital technology.

Our team moves fast on a variety of projects and technologies, in an environment where ideas need to be communicated concisely and effectively. Our ideal candidate should have excellent communication skills to interact with clients, designers, developers, marketers and senior management alike.

**What Applied Imagination Offers**

* Healthcare package

title: Senior Sales Engineer
description:
Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.


We are looking for a Spanish speaking Sales Engineer who is accustomed to solving customer’s most complex problems and closing large deals across Spanish speaking LATAM. In this role you will work directly with the sales team and channel partners to understand the needs of our customers, strategize on how to navigate winning sales cycles, provide compelling value-based demonstrations, support enterprise Proof of Concepts, and ultimately close business.



As a Snowflake Sales Engineer you must share our passion about reinventing the database space, thrive in a dynamic environment and have the flexibility and willingness to jump in and get things done. You are equally comfortable in both a business and technical context, interacting with executives and talking shop with technical audiences.


**IN THIS ROLE YOU WILL GET TO:**


* Present Snowflake technology and vision to executives and technical contributors at prospects and customers
* Work hands-on with prospects and customers to demonstrate and communicate the value of Snowflake technology throughout the sales cycle, from demo to proof of concept to design and implementation
* Immerse yourself in the ever-evolving industry, maintaining a deep understanding of competitive and complementary technologies and vendors and how to position Snowflake in relation to them.
* Collaborate with Product Management, Engineering, and Marketing to continuously improve Snowflake’s products and marketing
* Travel internationally at least 50% of the time

**ON DAY ONE WE WILL EXPECT YOU TO HAVE:**


* Fluency in Spanish, Portuguese a plus
* 7+ years of experience within a pre-sales environment
* 2+ years experience developing new markets
* 5+ years working with LATAM
* Outstanding presenting skills to both technical and executive audiences, whether impromptu on a whiteboard or using presentations and demos.
* Broad range of experience within large-scale Database and/or Data Warehouse technology, ETL, analytics and cloud technologies
* Hands-on expertise with SQL and Python
* Ability to connect a customer’s specific business problems and Snowflake’s solutions
* University degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics or related fields, or equivalent experience preferred


*Every Snowflake employee is expected to follow the company’s confidentiality and security standards for handling sensitive data. Snowflake employees must abide by the company’s data security plan as an essential part of their duties. It is every employee's duty to keep customer information secure and confidential.*
The following represents the expected range of compensation for this role:

* This role is eligible to participate in Snowflake's commission plan and it is common for employees in this role to receive total on-target earnings of $203,800 - $283,500. The estimated base salary for this role is $152,850 - $212,625.
* Additionally, this role is eligible to participate in Snowflake’s equity plan.


The successful candidate’s starting salary will be determined based on permissible, non-discriminatory factors such as skills, experience, and geographic location. This role is also eligible for a competitive benefits package that includes: medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance; 401(k) retirement plan; flexible spending & health savings account; at least 12 paid holidays; paid time off; parental leave; employee assistance program; and other company benefits.


Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.


How do you want to make your impact?

title: Industry Technical Sales Specialist
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------

  

The Enterprise & Government team is hiring an ITS to support our go to market sales efforts, this is a commissioned quota-based role, focused on influencing & selling solutions with our partner ecosystem, serving our covered accounts.


In this position you will help us with the following responsibilities:

* Influences and advocates technical abilities of Intel based products and solutions for Intel's BUs through a vertically oriented, solutions led approach to business and information technology (IT).
* Manages end customer technical relationships, provides technical expertise, and works with Intel business/account development and/or sales teams to drive Intel based product purchases.
* Develops technically advanced solutions that help solve customer business challenges, while creating significant pull for Intel's products and solutions.
* Collaborates with global cloud service providers (CSPs), digital services/SaaS providers, enterprise, cloud and public sector customers, independent software vendors (ISVs) and solutions integrator/managed service provider (SI/MSP) partners to maximize utilization of Intel products' capabilities.
* Develops the industry offerings to drive end customer deal wins and/or open new market segments for cloud based services in the industry.
* Exhibits solid understanding of key technology trends, industry segments and Intel's product lines to develop technically advanced solutions that help solve customer business problems, while creating significant pull for Intel's products and solutions.
* Works with the customers, partners/ISVs/SIs and BU development teams to create new solutions, software and services optimization through technical engagement and utilization of Intel product capabilities across the solution stack.
* Gathers customer feedback of assigned accounts to understand the drivers of satisfaction and/or dissatisfaction.
* Conveys deep technical requirements from partners and customers as a strategic input to product development roadmap.
* Delivers keynotes and presentations at Intel, industry and customers technical forums to position Intel as thought and product leader.
* Team player with great communication skill and positive attitude

  

Note: ***This is a commissioned sales position***.

**Qualifications**
------------------

  

You must possess the minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Requirements listed would be obtained through a combination of industry relevant job experience, internship experiences and or schoolwork/classes/research.


Minimum Qualifications:


Candidate must have:

* Bachelor’s degree in computer engineering/science or related field.
* 5+ years of technical field & customer facing experience.
* 10+ years of overall sales experience in the tech enterprise & Government field.


Preferred Qualifications

* Master’s degree in a technical or business field is a plus.
* 2+ years of Cloud, AI and High-Performance Computing Experience is a plus
* 2+ years of software solutions such as HPC & cloud software stacks, microservices, hypervisor, storage & AI training & inference software stacks including LLMs experience is a plus
* Proficiency with French language.

**Inside this Business Group**
------------------------------

  

Intel's Sales and Marketing (SMG) organization works with global customers and partners to solve critical business problems with Intel based technology solutions. SMG works across business units to amplify the customer voice and deliver solutions that accelerate their business. We work across numerous industries, including retail, enterprise and government, cloud services and healthcare as examples. The operations team focuses on forecasting, driving alignment with factory production and delivering efficiency tools and our marketing capability drives demand and localized marketing in locations around the globe. Our sales force navigates a complex partner and customer ecosystem while shaping product roadmaps, driving value for our customers, and collaborating to harness emerging technology trends to deliver comprehensive solutions.  

**Posting Statement**
---------------------

  

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.  

**Benefits**
------------

  

We offer a total compensation package that ranks among the best in the industry. It consists of competitive pay, stock, bonuses, as well as, benefit programs which include health, retirement, and vacation. Find more information about all of our Amazing Benefits here.  

  

Intel is committed to a culture of accessibility. Intel provides accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. Find information and request accommodation here.  

  

Annual Salary Range for jobs which could be performed in Canada:CAD 182,760.00-292,460.00  

Salary range dependent on a number of factors including location and experience  

**Working Model**
-----------------

  

This role is available as a fully home-based and generally would require you to attend Intel sites only occasionally based on business need. This role may also be available as our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site. **In certain circumstances the work model may change to accommodate business needs.**  

JobType


Fully Remote

title: Global Sales Engineering Strategy & Operations Lead
description:
Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.


Snowflake’s pre-sales team is actively seeking a Global Sales Engineering Strategy & Operations Lead to join our growing team. In this role you will be responsible for the overall global sales engineering go-to market initiatives in order to uplevel our sales engineering team and improve overall sales productivity. You will have the opportunity to apply your experience with technical training, content design, creation and go-to market messaging.



Reporting to the VP of Global Sales Engineering Strategy and Operations you will develop the strategy and creation of our sales engineering go-to market program in a scalable, repeatable and consistent manner on a global scale.


**IN THIS ROLE YOU WILL GE TO:**


* Collaborate closely with Sale Engineering Leadership, product management, and sales organization, in developing Sales Engineering go-to market pre-sales strategy, expertise and tools to enable our pre-sales team sell more effectively
* Lead Sales Engineering execution by assisting with planning, facilitating, coordinating and executing activities required to build the SE economy. Activities include training, knowledge capture and dissemination, partner coordination, and coordination with the other business units.
* Create and deliver content, information, and tools to prepare sales engineers to deliver on company business goals including building client relationships, identifying client need, how company products and services can meet client need and capturing opportunities within their accounts
* Develop deep, trusting relationships with Sales leadership and cross functional partners with ongoing communication to continually assess performance gaps and identify needs
* Help refine our pre-sales process and methodology, aligning it to our current sales workflow
* Leverage our sales enablement platforms to effectively deploy, manage and measure sales engineering training
* Find creative and fun ways to incentivize our pre-sales teams and their leadership to practice skills in their day to day operations

**ON DAY ONE WE WILL EXPECT YOU TO HAVE:**


* 7+ years of industry experience in a sales engineering or enablement role,
* Experience designing and developing go-to market strategy for a technical pre-sales team
* Direct experience working in the SaaS space. Data Science, Data Warehouse, Cloud, Analytics and/or Business Intelligence experience highly preferred
* Experience creating and delivering interactive and engaging in-person workshops and online scenario based programs, which practice client facing skills, such as discovery questioning, negotiation, objection handling, presentation, etc.
* Organized and able to manage and deliver multiple tasks efficiently, effectively and on time in a metrics based organization
* Excellent writing, editing, and oral communication skills
* Experience with knowledge management, learning management, and enterprise content tools preferred.


**ABOUT SNOWFLAKE:**



Snowflake is growing fast and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We’re passionate about our people, our customers, our values and our culture! We’re also looking for people with a growth mindset and the pragmatic insight to solve for today while building for the future. And as a Snowflake employee, you will be accountable for supporting and enabling diversity and belonging.



 Snowflake started with a clear vision: make modern data warehousing effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. Because traditional on-premises and cloud solutions struggle with this, Snowflake developed an innovative product with a new built-for-the-cloud architecture that combines the power of data warehousing, the flexibility of big data platforms, and the elasticity of the cloud at a fraction of the cost of traditional solutions.



Snowflake is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, pregnancy, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.



*Every Snowflake employee is expected to follow the company’s confidentiality and security standards for handling sensitive data. Snowflake employees must abide by the company’s data security plan as an essential part of their duties. It is every employee's duty to keep customer information secure and confidential.*

The following represents the expected range of compensation for this role:

* The estimated base salary range for this role is $162,000 - $231,000.
* Additionally, this role is eligible to participate in Snowflake’s bonus and equity plan.


The successful candidate’s starting salary will be determined based on permissible, non-discriminatory factors such as skills, experience, and geographic location. This role is also eligible for a competitive benefits package that includes: medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance; 401(k) retirement plan; flexible spending & health savings account; at least 12 paid holidays; paid time off; parental leave; employee assistance program; and other company benefits.


Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.


How do you want to make your impact?

title: Enterprise Sales Rep (IT Services) - US
description:
**Company Description** 

DOIT Security stands at the forefront of cloud security innovation in the burgeoning SASE category. Established in 2021, we are committed to delivering elite enterprise services on a global scale. We take pride in our excellence in reinforcing cyber defenses, mitigating data exfiltration risks, and driving cost efficiency through operational optimization. Our mission is not only to secure but also to enhance the enterprise user experience by integrating strategic services for greater infrastructure efficiency and innovation.

**Role Description** 

We are looking for a high-performing Enterprise Sales representative who will be responsible for bringing in clients and generating revenue for the organization. The incumbent will be responsible for generating new business prospects in the United States and any other U.S. territories within reach; establishing and nurturing long-lasting relationships with potential clients; and supporting our Technical Account Manager to bring the clients onboard. This is an opportunity to join a fast-growing team of talented professionals with a lot of positive energy and enthusiasm.

**This is a Part-Time, 100% remote contract role, with potential for a full-time role in the future.** 

**Responsibilities** 

* Responsible for generating revenue for the company by creating and delivering product demonstrations, gathering customer technical requirements, planning customer evaluation tests, and managing the evaluation process.
* Acquire and show an understanding of Doit's services—and effectively communicate the company's capabilities and benefits to potential customers in order to successfully manage and overcome prospect objections.
* Utilize Salesforce to accurately manage sales funnels.
* You will be the customer's primary point of contact for feedback and issue resolution, and their advocate for issues requiring HQ Support assistance. You will inform Product Management of customer requests for new features and product enhancements. This role covers SMB (2k employees) accounts.
* Provide remote product installations and custom product configurations
* Provide technical product presentations via web conferencing
* Technical training and end-user demonstration/evaluation assistance for channel partners
* Effectively interact with internal engineering teams to scope out and provide solutions to complex technical issues for highly visible account opportunities.

**Key to Success** 

* This role demands strong independence, initiative, and the ability to manage a diverse workload under tight deadlines. Candidates are expected to demonstrate excellent organizational skills, with a capacity to provide regular updates and maintain effective communication.
* Quick learning and implementing Sales Strategies in a fast-paced tech environment is highly preferred.

**Qualifications** 

* Bachelor's degree in IT/CS/ Data or any other IT related technical field Or at least 5-year Tech Sales experience preferably SaaS/ SaSE/ Cyber Security and other similar domain.
* Self-starter with a high level of motivation, a competitive disposition, and an uncanny ability to pay attention to detail.
* Team player with a desire and aptitude to operate in a high-growth sales atmosphere that is fast-paced and goal-oriented.
* Outstanding oral and written communication skills, as well as superior listening abilities.
* Demonstrate a technological ability.

**Supplementary Data** 

* We uphold the highest standards of confidentiality in compliance with EEO guidelines.

**What You Can Expect from Us** 

* Exposure to cutting-edge technologies and architecture.
* A stimulating, collegial, and fun working environment.
* Opportunities for professional development and career progression.

**Why Doit Security?** 

People that succeed at DOIT Security are intelligent, driven, and committed to our core principles. Consider the following question:

* Do you wish to collaborate with the greatest talent in the industry?
* Do you want to be a part of the development of disruptive technologies?
* Do you thrive in a fast-paced, changing environment?
* Do you value a workplace culture that encourages both individual and group success and recognizes and celebrates success?

If you answered yes, we would be delighted to speak with you about being a member of our award-winning team.

DOIT Security is an equal-opportunity workplace committed to diversity. We value and celebrate diversity, and we provide an inclusive atmosphere for all our employees and customers.

Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Pay: $25.00 - $35.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Experience level:

* 5 years

Application Question(s):

* Do you have any exposure to Cyber Security technologies/ platforms?

Experience:

* Tech Sales - Enterprises/ B2B: 4 years (Required)
* Cybersecurity Industry: 2 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Technical Sales Representative "Remote" Dallas TX
description:
**Imagine your future with us!**

At ALS, we encourage you to dream big. When you join ALS, you join a purpose and values-driven team that empowers you to innovate, create, and thrive. Our global team turns up each day with passion and commitment to do amazing things, always challenging our thinking to find ways to solve some of the world’s most complex problems for a safer, healthier world.

**About the role:**

The primary purpose of this position is to locate new customers and maintain good relationships with existing customer base. ALS Environmental is looking for a professional to sell laboratory services in Dallas and surrounding areas. The ideal candidate will have experience in; sales, environmental consulting, an environmental regulatory agency, or laboratory with a solid knowledge of the environmental testing industry.

**About you:**

* Develop prospect clients in assigned territory; maintain an existing client portfolio;
* Perform all related sales functions to meet sales territory goals;
* Deliver presentations/seminars for clients;
* Prepare and provide quotations as requested by existing and potential clients;
* Represent ALS Environmental at required trade shows and conferences;
* Participate in client appreciation, industry and promotional events;
* Meet required reporting due dates, deadlines, and operate in an organized manner and be available to work outside normal business hours as needed;
* Observe established safety regulations and comply with all ALS health and safety policies and procedures;
* Other duties as assigned.

**Required Qualifications:**

* Candidate must be professional in every aspect, self-motivated and flexible in working independently as well as with a team;
* Effective in consultative selling and relationship building with 100% commitment to success;
* Positive attitude, high energy, and dynamic with strong customer service skills;
* Experience with closing sales a must;
* Excellent verbal and written skills with knowledge of Microsoft Office programs;
* Previous experience working with CRM Software, Salesforce preferred.
* A degree in Science or related field, or equivalent preferred;
* Minimum 1 - 5 years selling experience required (2-3 years selling in the Environmental Industry and/or technical/Laboratory field preferred);
* Ability to travel extensively.

**Physical Demands:**

* Able to speak and hear clearly while communicating with staff, management, and clients;
* Able to sit, and/or stand for 100% of an 8 hour day;
* Dexterity in hands and fingers to operate computer and other equipment;
* Must have average vision and able to see to read reports and operate equipment.

**Working at ALS:** 

Our people are our most valuable asset and drive our success at ALS.We are a diverse community of dedicated professionals united by our passion to make a difference in the world. We reward excellence and uphold our values in our work and how we treat each other. At ALS, you’ll be supported to expand your skills and develop new ones so you can reach your full potential. We invest in our people with a range of programs and provide opportunities across the company, giving our people scope to grow diverse careers and develop as leaders. We want everyone to have a safe, flexible and rewarding career that makes a positive impact on our people, the planet and the communities where we work.

**Our benefits include:**

* Structured wage increases
* Comprehensive benefit package (including: medical, dental, and vision coverage, life and disability insurance, retirement plan with company match, employee assistance and wellness programs, access to company perks)
* Additional vacation days for years of service
* Business support for education or training after 9 months with the company
* Learning & development opportunities (unlimited access to e-learnings and more)

**About ALS:** 

ALS is a global leader in scientific testing, providing comprehensive testing solutions to clients in more than 60 countries across a wide range of industries, including environment, food and beverage, mining, personal care, pharmaceutical, healthcare and equipment reliability. Using state-of-the-art technologies and innovative methodologies, our dedicated international teams deliver the highest-quality testing services and personalized solutions supported by local expertise. We help our clients leverage the power of data-driven insights for a safer and healthier world.

**Everyone matters:**

ALS is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to achieving and maintaining a workforce which reflects and affirms the diversity of our society

ALS is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

EOE AA Minority, Female, Veteran, Individuals with Disabilities

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) 5% Match
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Experience level:

* 4 years

Schedule:
