Work Location: Remote

title: Sales and Onboarding Engineer
description:
Founded by educators and technologists passionate about improving education, Clever is on a mission to unlock new ways to learn for all students. Already used by more than 75% of U.S. K-12 schools, Clever brings all applications into one secure portal and provides single sign-on for everyone. With the leading network of digital learning providers, Clever makes school more engaging, personalized, and fun.


As an Sales and Onboarding Engineer, situated within the Education and Onboarding team, you will be the primary technical point-of-contact for customers, navigating their pre-sales and onboarding experience to Clever's paid products such as *(but not limited to)* Clever IDM, MFA+, Classroom MFA, and Google Bundle. You will use your technical expertise and amazing customer-facing skills to delight district partners and serve as a crucial cross-functional resource to internal stakeholders. As a subject matter expert on the paid products you support you'll ensure that customer needs are met and that the onboarding process is a seamless experience. You'll build infrastructure, processes, and documentation paving the way for Clever to scale adoption of its paid offerings.


**A DAY IN THE LIFE:**


* Drive technical discussions and articulate Clever's paid product functionality in pre-sales meetings. Deeply understand the clients' technical needs and propose solution architectures to meet their needs, leveraging Clever's core and paid products.
* Be the voice of the customer in conversations with Product and Engineering to drive improvements across the product suite.
* Lead onboarding kick off and troubleshooting calls with customers who have purchased products, while managing the queue of onboarding and pre-sales cases.
* Execute on onboarding plans for mid and big districts that may require more detailed onboard
* Send proactive outreach to clients–nudging them through their next onboarding steps.
* Leverage your strong relationship-building skills to provide exceptional support for customers.
* Build technical credibility with the district's key stakeholders
* Maintain deep product knowledge about the general Clever product, and serve as a subject matter expert for the paid products you support.
* Work closely with the District Partnerships team throughout the pre-sale process. Contribute to proposal preparation and strategize with the team to increase our chances at closing sales.
* Build processes to improve internal efficiencies and enhance the customer experience in the pre-sales and onboarding cycles.
* Collaborate cross-functionally across the internal teams including Customer Support, Product, and Engineering teams to resolve customer issues and queries expeditiously and attain high degree of customer satisfaction.


**WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR:**


* You have excellent interpersonal and communication skills. You can explain complex technical topics in an easily-digestible manner.
* You are able to self-manage and context switch across accounts, product areas, work streams, and more.
* You can constructively engage district administrators, hone in on their underlying needs, and construct the optimal solution for them.
* You have deep empathy for our district administrators and are committed to supporting the District Partnerships team needs.
* You understand the ins and outs of the full Clever product, Student Information Systems, and IDPs.
* You're a creative problem solver and demonstrate strong judgment in solving complex and ambiguous technical issues.
* You can teach others complex technical concepts to internal and external stakeholders.
* You're a strong collaborator. You love partnering across different internal teams to solve sticky issues.
* You have strong prioritization and organizational skills and you thrive in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment.
* You're a team player and are able to jump in to support your colleagues' needs.
* You are open to giving and receiving feedback from your peers across cross-functional teams and are committed to addressing the feedback received.
* You have at least 1 year of experience in a customer-facing role at Clever and your broader work experience relates to the role and responsibilities outlined above.
* You love working with customers, and have a proven track record of building trust and rapport with enterprise clients.
* Customer-facing experience: Professional Services, Technical Implementation, and/or a consulting background is highly preferred.
* You have a process improvement orientation–you seek to drive efficiencies for customers and Clever teams.
* You're a strong cross-functional collaborator–you're adept at partnering with other teams to deliver results.
* You are familiar with Google Admin Console or Active Directory for Identity Management.
* You have an aptitude for technical pre-sales and post-sales with a good mix of selling and technical acumen.
* Ability to 8:00am to 4:00pm Eastern time


**CLEVER BENEFITS AND PERKS:**


* A competitive salary
* Flexible Paid Time Off
* Paid Parental Leave
* Top-notch healthcare, vision, and dental coverage for you and your family
* Best-in-class mental healthcare service that supports employees' mental and emotional wellness
* A generous personal development yearly budget which can be used for courses, conferences, trainings, books, and more
* LinkedIn Learning subscription with unlimited access to thousands of expert-led online courses
* Annual company and team retreats to connect with fun, bright coworkers


**SALARY TRANSPARENCY:**



The range of our base salary cash compensation for this role for candidates living in the United States, besides NYC and San Francisco, CA, is between **$81,900 - $96,300**. For candidates living in NYC and San Francisco, CA is between **$90,000 - $105,900.** This position also offers a 10% target, variable annual bonus incentive. All final offers are determined using multiple factors including experience and level of expertise.

 **Clever does not conduct interviews via text or Telegram. We will never ask for your financial information or reimbursement of equipment of any kind. If you receive any communications regarding employment with Clever that you think might be a scam, please email security@clever.com.**

title: Technical Sales Engineer
description:
**About us**

Kagool is a global Microsoft System Integrator and partner of SAP and Databricks. We are committed to creating and providing industry-specific solutions that help our clients achieve their business transformation objectives. Our expertise, industry experience, and proprietary knowledge are what truly set us apart from the competition. We have established and continue to maintain a strategic relationship with Microsoft, which has recognized our achievements in collaborating with clients to offer innovative digital solutions and services year after year.

**Role Description**

The role is for a **Technical Presales Engineer** with expertise in Data, Analytics, Al/ML. The consultant will be responsible for various day-to-day tasks associated with serving as an expert in the consultative design and selling of technical solutions to prospective clients.

* ﻿﻿Collaborate and build relationships with the Microsoft and Databricks Technical teams to create awareness within the partner's internal teams.
* ﻿﻿Lead presales activities throughout the entire sales cycle, including customer meetings, architecture discussions, proof of concepts, demos, and building ROI/TCO.
* ﻿﻿Play a key role in preparing proposals and bids, and create compelling, customized presentations tailored to the customer's use case.
* ﻿﻿Generate new leads that align with our services capability and manage the end-to-end sales process to secure deals.

**Qualifications**

* ﻿﻿Intensive experience with Microsoft Azure data services, Azure OpenAl, and Databricks is a must.
* ﻿﻿Presales and Sales: Drive the presales process by researching and identifying potential opportunities, qualifying potential opportunities, and accurately forecasting opportunities
* ﻿﻿Bachelor's degree in Computer Science
* ﻿﻿Experience in delivering SAP Data Management solutions is a plus
* ﻿﻿Experience in delivering data projects such as data warehousing, data migration, and ETL is a plus

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $91,692.00 - $101,092.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Sales Engineer
description:
**Benefits:**  

* 401(k)
* Bonus based on performance
* Dental insurance
* Employee discounts
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

  

**Job Summary:**  

  

This position is part of the Hytera US Inc. Sales Team, reporting to the Sales Engineering Director, supporting all pre-sale engineering activities in the region. The primary focus for this position is to support Dealers in our PTT over Cellular (PoC) product offerings. Although the primary focus will be PoC, the SE will be expected to assist in other areas as the need arise, and grow into a Digital Mobile Radio product expert. In the near term, the SE will focus strongly on post-sale support activities (for PoC products) of reasonable complexity, with a gradual migration to pre-sale activities.  

  

The SE will provide pre-sale and post-sale customer/dealer/sales manager/marketing support, system integration, and feedback to the product management team on product issues and improvements.  

  

Each SE has several products for which they are Product Champions. This means they are the Subject Matter Expert on the product and is responsible for training all other SE’s, Sales Staff and Technical Support on the product. Marketing will need assistance to ensure accurate literature and more. The SE will create training plans, work with new and existing dealers to ensure they understand the product and can provide great support to their end users.  

  

**Supervisory Responsibilities**:  

  

* None

  

  

**Duties/Responsibilities:**  

  

* Collaborate with customers, dealers, sales staff and engineering to evaluate customer requirements and generate solutions that will ensure customer needs are met or exceeded.
* Investigate complaints from customers, identify the issue, and recommend solutions to the customer.
* Configure, test and install systems and terminal equipment for demonstrations or trials. Provide technical support and assistance to sales throughout the sales process, including technical qualification of opportunities.
* Collaborate with sales to ensure the proposed solution will address the customer needs and all relevant equipment has been accounted for in the proposal.

  

* Advise customers on the correct programming and implementation of Hytera equipment for the specific customer requirements.
* Be confident to prepare and present solutions to customers with minimal direction from sales.
* Participate and/or lead large direct bid opportunities.
* Participate and provide sales engineering support for tradeshows, as well as attend and host clients at the booth.
* Prepare and present webinars and training to dealers and end customers.
* Prepare and edit end-user documentation for system deployments.
* Have a good understanding of Wi-Fi, IP routing and switching, VPN tunnels, and can speak with confidence about these technologies.
* Create and maintain training courses and certification testing on training and development portal.
* Android app knowledge.
* Ability to work independently and a self-starter.
* Analytical thinking – being able to take complex issues with lots of moving parts and breaking it down into manageable parts. Then explaining that to the relevant individuals that need to work on the issue.
* Minor software development or scripting experience.
* Have some exposure to product marketing and drive to understand the market that the product is being sold into.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

*The following skills are a plus:*  

* App development experience
* Minor Database organization and scripting
* A good understanding of DMR Tier 2 and Tier 3 specifications and technology.
* Basic knowledge of Android OS and its debug command set
* Knowledgeable about LTE and operating devices on LTE networks.
* Installation and configuration of advanced dispatch and media management software solutions.

**Required Skills/Abilities:**  

  

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Excellent sales and customer service skills with a proven ability to explain products to non-technical audiences.
* Ability to apply engineering, technology, or other related principles to product sales.
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software.
* Ability to travel as required.


  

**Education and Experience:**  

  

* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering
* 3+ years of work experience with a focus on the duties listed above

  

  

This is a remote position.

title: Solution Architect
description:
**Solution Architect**  

*(Military Veterans are highly encouraged to apply)*  

  

**Role Overview**  

BDR Solutions, LLC seeks a Solution Architect to join the BDR Growth Team. The Solution Architect will be responsible for leading and designing technical solutions, processes, and staffing mix within the domains of systems engineering, data and business analytics, data science, cyber security, management consulting, healthcare IT, and program management to create and craft high-quality technical solutions for written proposals, white papers, client engagements, and oral presentations. This position will report to the Senior Vice President of Growth. The ideal candidate will have experience serving in leadership roles on Federal IT proposals with prior experience serving as a technical solution architect or technical capture manager.  

  

**Responsibilities*** Assess technical requirements and objectives and design technical IT and management solutions applying industry best practices, frameworks, and technologies (e.g., DAMA DMBOK, Agile, Cloud, DevSecOps, low-code/no-code platforms, AI/ML, etc.) resulting in tailored solutions for integration into the written technical proposal, white papers, client presentations, and oral presentations.
* Apply analytics, problem-solving, and communication skills to identify best-fit technology solutions aligned to client requirements to deliver winning proposals to federal civilian, federal health, and other federal markets.
* Architect and design innovative, cost-effective technical solutions that meet and exceed customer requirements.
* Design approaches that optimize enterprise architecture across customer needs, business constraints, and technological implementation feasibility.
* Provide technical leadership and consulting level support on industry trends and standards on business and technical solutions.
* Provide facilitation for collaborative calls with partners, internal staff, and clients.
* Collect and process strategic plans, goals, and objectives for Veterans Affairs (VA), Department of Homeland Security, Department of Defense, and other Federal agencies.
* Collaborate with BDR Growth and Operations teams leading technical direction to support the business development lifecycle including pre-sales, capture, and proposal.
* Create technical solutions for proposals and manage technical response development by partnering with contributors from various internal and external teams via virtual and/or in-person meetings.
* Research and provide context and feasibility of solutions relative to customer business needs
* Support project start-up by performing technical interviews for resources to deliver work assignments.
* Lead technical aspects of the capture lifecycle including pre-proposal planning activities, kick-off meetings, value proposition conveyance, theme development, technical solution feasibility, technical writing, and technical reviews.
* Review/analyze proposal sections for consistency and clarity: Compliance with solicitation requirements, and alignment with proposed solutions and themes.
* Collaboratively work with business development, R&D, and operational leadership to obtain adequate resources for accomplishing high-quality proposal development in a timely manner.
* Ongoing improvements: Assist in the development and refinement of templates and standardized processes to streamline proposal development.

**Required Minimum Qualifications*** Demonstrate a minimum of 8+ years of experience in solution delivery, implementation, or engineering within DevSecOps, SDLC, Agile, Cloud optimization, and/or emerging technologies/capabilities (e.g., AI/ML, RPA, ZTA, etc.).
* In-depth business and technical knowledge of technology trends and standards in government IT and digital services transformation
* Experience leading technical discussions including the ability to take part in persuasive discourse with peers, partners, capture, pricing, and executive leadership
* Proven experience to architect technical solutions based on client requirements
* Ability to manage several proposals, projects, and priorities
* Experience and expertise within the Federal IT market space
* High level of expertise in Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint).
* Proven excellent oral and written communication.

**Ideal Experience*** Proven experience working in a pace environment with a successful track record supporting proposals under VA T4NG, GSA MAS99 54151S, STARS III, and CIO-SP3.
* Dynamic interpersonal skills to interact with a variety of audiences (e.g., Executive management, subcontractors, technical and management staff)
* Demonstrated experience communicating clearly orally and in writing, and producing high-quality written products.
* Strong relationships with technology vendors or service providers


In addition, U.S. citizenship is required. Individuals will be subject to a background investigation including, but not limited to criminal history, employment and education verification, drug testing, and creditworthiness.  

BDR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or genetic information.  

  

  

**About BDR Solutions:**  

  

BDR Solutions delivers IT expertise and solutions that improve American lives through the modernization of government systems for health benefits, social services, and disaster relief. We are a service-disabled veteran-owned, 8(a), HUBZone small business—recognized for reliable and sustainable outcomes scaled to our client’s mission needs.

title: Enterprise Sales Engineer
description:
**ABOUT RETOOL:**

Nearly every company in the world runs on custom software: Gartner estimates that up to 50% of all code is written for internal use. This is the operational software for refunding orders, underwriting loans, onboarding employees, analyzing transactions, and providing customer support. But most companies don't have adequate resources to properly invest in these tools, leading to a lot of old and clunky internal software or, even worse, users still stuck in manual and spreadsheet flows.



At Retool, we're on a mission to bring good software to everyone. We're building a new type of development platform that combines the benefits of traditional software development with a drag-and-drop UI editor and AI, making it dramatically faster to build internal tools. We believe that the future of software development lies in abstracting away the tedious and repetitive tasks developers waste time on, while creating reusable components that act as a force multiplier for future developers and projects. The result is not just productivity, but good software by default. And that's a mission worth striving for.



Today, our customers span from small startups building their first operational tools to Fortune 500 companies building mission-critical apps for thousands of users across their business. Interested in joining us? Let us know!


**WHY WE'RE LOOKING FOR YOU:**



Our sales engineering team is critical to Retool. Sales Engineers drive revenue by partnering closely with potential customers and ensuring they're successful with Retool. A large portion of the Retool sales process is technical, ensuring potential customers understand how to build internal apps with Retool, deploy on their infrastructure, and connect to their critical resources. Building successful relationships with our customers is a key component of this role and you'll leverage your engineering background to dive in. Our revenue and business goals this year are aggressive, and we need the right team to help turn prospects into happy Retool customers.


**WHAT YOU'LL DO:**



Your workday will never be boring. You'll dive deep with prospects to understand their technical environment and their business goals. You'll create and deliver demos, build apps within Retool with prospects, answer technical questions, and manage the technical close throughout the sales cycle. At this stage in Retool's journey, we'll also look to you to help build new processes and programs to help our sales team meet and exceed quota.


**WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH:**



You'll join our team of Enterprise Sales Engineers and partner closely with our Enterprise Account Executives. You'll also work cross-functionally with the rest of the go-to-market team. You'll be joining a broader team of Retools who are passionate about serving our customers, enjoy collaborating to build an incredibly innovative product, and partake in some occasional but well-intentioned sarcasm. If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you!


### **IN THIS ROLE, YOU'LL:**


* Talk with potential customers, understand their problems, and assess whether or not Retool is a good fit
* Identify relevant stakeholders, budgets, timelines, etc. and manage the entire sales process
* Demo the Retool product, answer questions about Retool, ultimately convincing them Retool is the correct solution
* Create technical content to demonstrate best practices (e.g. sample apps, documentation, videos, etc.)
* Suss out the blockers for a customer in adopting Retool, and overcome them
* Dive into our codebase to understand technical limitations in Retool that need solving via code (e.g. a bug, a missing feature, etc.) to close a deal
* Serve as the primary, ongoing technical point of contact for our users in the presales process
* Answer technical questions from our customers as they come up

### **THE SKILLSET YOU'll BRING:**


* Experience working in the presales phase with large Enterprise customers
* An enthusiastic, strong, technical generalist
* A background in computer science or a related field
* Technical experience in a professional environment, ideally a startup
* Strong knowledge of SQL, various no-SQL databases, APIs, etc.
* Comfort exploring Retool's codebase (React / Node)
* Previous experience talking with customers and solving their problems
* Ability to think on your feet, and solve problems during calls with technical customers


For candidates based in the United States, the annual base salary range is listed below. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Retool and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors such as (but not limited to), scope and responsibilities, the candidate's experience and qualifications, and location.



Additional compensation in the form(s) of equity, and/or commission/bonuses are dependent on the position offered. Retool provides a comprehensive benefit plan, including medical, dental, vision, and 401(k). Pay and benefits are subject to change at any time, consistent with the terms of any applicable compensation or benefit plans.

**United States pay range**


$173,000—$220,000 USD
Retool offers generous benefits to all employees and hybrid work location. For more information, please visit the benefits and perks section of our careers page!



Retool is currently set up to employ all roles in the US and specific roles in the UK. To find roles that can be employed in the UK, please refer to our careers page and review the indicated locations.

title: Sales Engineer
description:
*Mark43 is approved to hire in 40 states*, including*AL, AZ, CA-excluding San Francisco, CO, CT, DC, DE, FL, GA, IA, ID, IL, IN, KS, LA, MA, MD, ME, MI, MN, MO, NE, NV, NH, NJ, NM, NY, NC, OH, OR, PA, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VA, VT, WA, and WI.* Before applying to a remote role, please ensure that *you are able to* perform the position*in one of the states listed above. State locations and specifics are subject to change as our hiring requirements shift.*


Mark43's mission is to empower communities and their governments with new technologies that improve the safety and quality of life for all. We build powerful, scalable, and elegant software that sets a new standard for the tools upon which our first responders rely. Our users are diverse, and we are therefore committed to embracing diversity of thought and experience within our team.



We are seeking a Sales Engineer to join our team. A background in public safety is strongly preferred. This role requires close collaboration with several different internal teams at Mark43. You will be responsible for designing and implementing software solutions that meet the needs of clients. To be successful in this role, you will need to establish a personal rapport with potential and current customers, vendors, and partners. You will need a deep understanding of the technical requirements that will ensure the success of our product deployments to public safety agencies. This is a fully remote position with a 25% travel expectation.

  


**Primary Responsibilities:**


**Proposal Engineering**: You will create documentation for project bids, including estimated timelines, costs, and potential risks. You will review requests for proposals (RFPs) to analyze the company's requirements and determine if the customer is a good fit.


* Identify customer needs and develop solutions that meet their requirements.
* Work alongside other sales team members to present products to clients and answer any technical questions they may have.
* Analyze client requirements and determine if a potential customer is a good fit for Mark43.
* Outline anticipated timelines for projects by leveraging internal resources and determining the most efficient processes.
* Create documentation for project bids, including estimated timelines, costs, and potential risks.
* Develop practical demonstrations of proposed solutions.
* Test newly implemented software and correct any programming flaws that lead to system issues.

  


**Secondary Responsibilities:**


**Sales Engineering**: You will collaborate with other department engineers to create practical demonstrations of proposed solutions. You are required to test the implemented software and fix programming bugs that create errors with the system.


**Implementation Engineering**: You will be responsible for SCOPING Mark43 technologies with enterprise systems. You will work with a variety of clients, from small agencies to large police departments. You will help them integrate new software into their existing infrastructure.

  


**What You Will Need:**



To be successful in this role, you should have:


* A bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related engineering fields.
* Experience developing IT and cloud infrastructure.
* Up-to-date understanding of best practices regarding system security measures.
* Experience with software engineering, customer experience, and design architecture.
* Advanced understanding of business analysis techniques and processes.
* Project development and leadership skills are preferred.

  

Mark43 is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information. As part of this commitment, we will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed, please email recruiting@Mark43.com requesting the accommodation.

title: Sales Engineer
description:
**BHS Robotics** is seeking a Remote **Sales Engineer** to join our team!

If you are an experienced industrial equipment Sales Engineer, come join the best team in the custom automation industry! The Technical Sales Engineer for BHS Robotics builds and manages strategic relationships and growth opportunities for BHS Robotics. Using a consultative sales approach, the Technical Sales Engineer engages with clients to fully understand their needs and works with our experienced, cross-functional engineering team to develop the very best solutions.

With our history of strong customer relationships, BHS Robotics is an account-based strategic engineered solutions provider. We provide standard solutions as well as custom built, large scale, complex systems. You will become a trusted partner to our clients.

See more about BHS Robotics at: www.bhs-robotics.com

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Meet or exceed sales and project profit targets.
* Manage Existing Account Relationships.
* Maintain & Nurture Existing Accounts to increase sales.
* Expand client contacts within Existing Accounts.
* Conduct regular value-based customer contacts.
* Serve as key contact in escalation issues.
* New Account Development
* Define strategic business plan and execute against sales goals.
* Qualify new opportunities provided through marketing & trade shows.
* Cultivate new opportunities through referrals and networking.
* New Market Development
* Discover new product solutions, markets and applications.
* Identify marketing material needs and assist with content development.
* General / Administration
* Manage leads in the CRM for tracking, reporting, internal communication and follow up.
* Respond to RFQs and develop strategies to close sales.
* Develop solution concepts and sales proposals.
* Keep current on industry and market trends, new technology, tools, and software.

**QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE**

* College level in Science, Engineering, Business, or other relevant academic field.
* Minimum five (5) years experience selling industrial equipment/machinery to end users, senior management / (C-suite preferred)Ability to travel domestically and internationally as required.CRM experience and experience utilizing Microsoft 365 suite applications.
* Engineering background in design, build and install or service of custom equipment would be considered an asset.**ENVIRONMENTAL AND PHYSICAL DEMANDS**
* Occasional overnight, weekend and extended travel as required, potentially international up to 50% of the time
* Valid driver’s license requiredValid auto insurance requiredValid passport preferred.
* **COMPETENCIES**
* Knowledge of the capital equipment market conditions, automation solutions and competitive landscape in addition to a robust understanding of general manufacturing practices.
* Proven sales track record in the manufacturing, automation and/or capital equipment industry.
* Ability to work with and gather pertinent information from all manufacturing levels. Build trust while developing strategic opportunities from key decision makers and influencers within existing and new customers.
* Proven skills in building and expanding customer relationships.
* Strong presentation skills coupled with awareness to adapt to your style, tone, and message to match your audience.
* Sharp negotiation skills honed to close deals with successful outcomes for all stakeholders.

**SALARY:**

$105k - $120K + commissions + full benefits as seen below!

**BENFITS:**

* Medical, Dental, Vision and Insurance
* Company-Paid Life Insurance
* Company-Paid Short-Term Disability Insurance
* Company-Paid Long-Term Disability Insurance
* Generous 6% 401(k) Match
* HSA/FSA (eligible for BHS contribution into HSA)
* Vacation / Paid Time Off
* Parental Leave – 3 weeks paid
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Legal Assist and ID Theft

**ABOUT THE COMPANY:**

BHS Robotics is a provider of automated manufacturing solutions to improve the productivity, safety, and profitability of our customers. With over 3,000 installations nationwide, BHS Robotics system solutions are found in a broad range of industries with special emphasis on corrugated containers, plastic processing, packaging, building materials, and consumer products.

Founded in 1910 as Chicago Electric, BHS Robotics has always been a leader in drive and control technology for industry. Still family-owned, we are proud of our long heritage of quality workmanship and outstanding customer service. Our teams are vertically integrated with all disciplines inclusive to the BHS business, including design, engineering, panel building, programming, testing, fabrication, installation, startup, and service.

BHS Robotics is a proud member of the global BHS-World companies, headquartered in Weiherhammer, Germany.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $105,000.00 - $125,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Disability insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Application Question(s):

* Do you have experience in industrial automation?
* How many years of capital equipment sales experience do you have?

Work Location: Remote

title: Solutions Engineer
description:
FAAC Technologies is a world leader in access automation, parking and access control, including 32 sales companies, more than 2.500 employees worldwide and 18 manufacturing plants.


HUB Parking Technology is the Business Unit of FAAC Technologies that develops, manufactures, installs, and provides after-sales services for HUB Parking Access and Revenue Control Systems. We aim to meet every market expectation by offering a wide range of solutions from one of our three Parking Systems Brands. **\\*\\*MUST HAVE CUSTOMER-FACING PARKING EXPERIENCE\\*\\***


**Responsibilities:**


* Attend on-site survey walks as needed for the purpose of confirming system configuration and capability based on conditions found.
* Assist the Sales Team as an industry and system expert, to answer and explain to customers the benefit of using TIBA or HUB systems.
* Manage System Requirement expectations to the customer in collaboration with the Project Management team.
* Engage with strategic projects until final sign off is obtained.
* Review and comment on system capability of technical documents required by RFP's, RFI's and customer inquiries.
* Work with the R&D, Training, Marketing and Operations teams to become system and content expert for the purpose of providing high-level, technical expertise and support for solutions to end-user customers by using a consultative approach.
* Respond to and complete Sales Requests and inquiries in a timely manner based on assignments by your manager.
* Support the sales team efforts by providing solutions and technical expertise and workflow assessment to end-user customers.
* Demonstrate a strong commitment to excellence, persistence and overcoming obstacles.
* Demonstrate initiative with the ability to seek out relevant information along with operating with a sense of urgency.


**Benefits:**


* Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance
* 401k Benefits (with a company match after 1st year)
* Paid Time Off (3 weeks earned in 1st year)
* Voluntary: Additional Life Insurance, AFLAC Accident and/or Critical Insurance and Legal/ID Shield, Discounted Tickets Program
* State of the art facilities, delivery centers and worldwide partners.
* Awesome co-workers and business partners


**What we offer you:**


HUB Parking Technology delivers the flexibility, professional expertise and close personal service of a local company, together with all the capabilities, network and strength of a global player. Through its local subsidiaries and distributors, it is represented in North & South America, Europe, Africa, the Middle East, Asia and Australia. Over the years, the company has constantly innovated to develop state-of-the-art systems that make parking efficient for users as well as profitable and easy to manage for operators. In the meantime, HUB Parking Technology has remained keenly focused on enhancing its technology differentiation and delivering integrated, value-added solutions. Learn more about us at www.hubparking.com

title: Jr. Solutions Engineer
description:
**EXCLUSIVE NETWORKS** |**Introduction**


Exclusive Networks (EXN) is a global cybersecurity specialist that provides partners and end-customers with a wide range of services and product portfolios via proven routes to market. With offices in over 45 countries and the ability to serve customers in over 170 countries, we combine a local perspective with the scale and delivery of a single global organisation.  

Our best-in-class vendor portfolio is carefully curated with all leading industry players. Our services range from managed security to specialist technical accreditation and training and capitalize on rapidly evolving technologies and changing business models. For more information visit www.exclusive-networks.com.
At Exclusive Networks, we are passionate about making a difference. That means delivering the best to our clients, doing our part to create a prosperous and trusted digital world, and helping our people to realize their potential.**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES** |**About the role**


The Junior Solutions Engineer will work with Senior Solutions Engineers to consult and advise customers on networking and security solutions. The Solution Engineer influences both technical and business partners by translating business objectives into technical and technology solutions.This will be done by conducting hands-on demo, technical/technology benefits discussions, solution-oriented design, and implementation/deployment guidance.


This role will report to the Sr. Director of Supports & Services.

**As the Jr. Solutions Engineer, you will:**

* Provide pre-sales technical consultation for the design and implementation of sophisticated products, applications, and solutions.
* Collaborate with sales teams, vendors, and industry partners in assessing potential application of our products, ensuring that optimum systems solutions are provided to new and existing customers.
* Develop and execute technical sales plans and proposals (RFP, RFQ) to grow Exclusives business in a driven and opportunity-filled sales environment.
* Build, develop, and maintain strong professional relationships with customer IT decision-makers and industry partner community.
* Deliver training and support to our industry partners and customer engineers.
* Continuously learn and stay ahead of the industry and competitive solutions, products, and services
* Enjoy the personal growth career opportunity that comes from exposure to the latest technological innovations and apply these capabilities to address the real-world challenges of our customers.

**QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE** |**About you**

**The ideal Jr. Solutions Engineer:**

* A minimum of 1 year experience in a technical/pre-sales role as a Sales or Systems Engineer
* A bachelor's and/or masters degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, and related field or equivalent experience.
* Hands-on experience in designing/engineering/implementing LAN/WAN in SMB or home network.
* Confirmed understanding and hands-on expertise with networking products and technologies across the routing, switching, and security domains.
* Strong interpersonal, relationship, and communication skills with experience in customer-facing sales activities.
* Proven technical capabilities, an ability to learn quickly, and apply skills on new protocols and applications.
* Understanding of Network Security standards such as NGFW, UTM, DDoS, or IPSec
* Hands-on experience with Juniper Networks solutions is a plus.


Preferred Qualifications:

* Proficient understanding of emerging technology areas. This includes Virtualization, VMWare, OpenStack, Contrail, VNF, and Container solutions.
* Familiarization Command Line Interface (CLI), Linux hands-on experience is a plus.
* Networking industry certification

 **WHO IS EXCLUSIVE NETWORKS?** | **About the company**


Exclusive Networks is a global trusted cybersecurity specialist, committed to upholding the highest ethical standards. We are committed to fostering, embracing, encouraging, and preserving a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion.


We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to the recruitment and hiring of individuals from diverse backgrounds and experiences, as we believe this strengthens our ability to develop superior solutions, make informed decisions, and better serve our valued customers. We do not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, disability status, or any similar characteristic. Employment decisions are made solely on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Please click here to review our Diversity and Inclusion Policy for further information.


We care about your data: please click here to read our Recruitment Data Protection Policy prior to applying, and therefore sharing your data with us.

**Our benefits include:**

* Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Short term disability, FSA, HSA plans
* 401(k) Employer Match
* Vacation (3 weeks)
* Sick (5 days)
* Holidays (12 holidays)

**WORKING CONDITIONS**

* Must be legally able to work in the country you applied (USA)
* Remote Work
* Salary: $70-$77K OTE
* Travel Requirements: 30% of the time

title: Enterprise Sales Executive
description:
PrismHR is a leading provider of Cloud-Based HCM platform technology and service solutions for the regional PEO, ASO, and Payroll Service Bureaus market. Our contemporary and comprehensive solutions are the foundation of the regional PEO, ASO, and Payroll Service Bureaus’ business and helps increase operational efficiency and accelerates revenue growth by increasing competitive win rates and increasing revenue per client. PrismHR is the dominant provider for PEOs and now seeks to aggressively expand our presence in the ASO and Payroll Service Bureau community. We have a unique career opportunity for proven and experienced Sales Professionals to assist us in elevating our presence in the ASO/Payroll Service Bureau market.  
**Responsibilities:**

* Successfully managing enterprise level sales process from opportunity creation to close, according to PrismHR’s diagnostic sales methodology. This will include working closely with Sales Engineers, Implementation Team, and other Subject Matter Experts (SME’s) to assist in winning opportunities and to meet and exceed assigned sales quotas.
* Opportunity Development: Find, develop, and mature relationships with regional payroll service bureaus, ASO (Administrative Service Organizations), or accountancies who provide Payroll/HCM solutions to sell our HCM Platform.
* Work hand in hand with the marketing and business development team on demand generation campaigns and lead qualification and development.
* Attend National and Regional Trade Association events, such as the Independent Payroll Providers Association, to grow awareness and find prospective opportunities.
* Develop and manage a sales pipeline to meet and exceed assigned sales quotas and objectives. Will need to leverage PrismHR’s CRM and be responsible for capturing all required information on prospective sales opportunities and to record, schedule, and manage sales steps and process.
* Meet regularly with the SVP of HCM Sales to review overall progress, review sales pipeline, and strategize on sales opportunities.
* Develop and present quarterly business reviews to Leadership.
* Learn and effectively present Company and Solution value propositions.
* Learn and effectively discuss key decision drivers, competitive advantages, and market trends in the regional Payroll Service Bureau/HCM space.

**Qualifications:**

* 5+ years of direct enterprise level selling experience, representing cloud-based (SaaS) software solutions to C-Level buyers.
* Specific experience selling Human Capital Management or Workforce Management software and service solutions.
* Proven ability to consistently meet and exceed assigned sales quotas and objectives.
* Proven ability to run and manage an enterprise level sales process, including the ability to effectively find and define the buyers key buying reasons through diagnostic discovery.
* Board level presence with strong communication and presentation skills.
* Ability to operate in a dynamic, growth-oriented environment with a desire to assist in developing strategies and processes.
* Strong MS Office skills including MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
* Please note: This position can be remote. Notice for candidates located in the following states: CA, CO, NJ, NY, WA: The base salary range for this position is between $80,000 - $100,000 (salary is dependent on location, experience, knowledge, and skills based on the responsibilities outlined in the job description).

#LI-REMOTEPrismHR is a fast-paced SaaS company which provides customers with a cloud-based payroll process software application. PrismHR also provides professional services including system implementation consulting, custom configurations, and training. Lastly, via the Company’s Marketplace platform customers and end users access other human resources and employee benefits applications from PrismHR’s Marketplace Partners.  
**Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Program/Affirmative Action Plan:**  
We have transformed our company into an inclusive environment where individuals are valued for their talents and empowered to reach their fullest potential. At PrismHR, we strive to continually lead with our values and beliefs that enable our employees to develop their potential, bring their full self to work, and engage in a world of inclusion.

Ensuring an inclusive environment for our employees is an integral part of the PrismHR culture. We aren't just checking a box, we are truly committed to creating a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our employees and fosters a sense of belonging for everyone. This is essential to our success. We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about our roles but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for these open roles or other open roles. We particularly encourage applicants from traditionally under-represented groups as we seek to increase the diversity of our workforce and provide fair opportunities for all.

As a proud Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, PrismHR encourages talent from all backgrounds to join our team. Employment decisions are based on an individual’s qualifications as they relate to the job under consideration. The Company’s policy prohibits unlawful discrimination based on sex (which includes pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions, the actual sex of the individual, or the gender identity or gender expression), race, color, religion, including religious dress practices and religious grooming practices, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, familial status, age, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, protected veteran or military status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state or local laws, ordinances, or regulations.

The Company is committed to complying with all applicable laws providing equal employment opportunities. This commitment applies to all persons involved in the operations of the Company and prohibits unlawful discrimination by any employee of the Company, including supervisors and co-workers.  
Privacy Policy: For information about how we collect and use your personal information, please see our privacy statement available at https://www.prismhr.com/about/privacy-policy.  
*PrismHR provides reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in job application procedures. If you have any difficulty using our online system and you need a reasonable accommodation due to a disability, you may use the following alternative email address to contact us about your interest in employment at PrismHR: taglobal@prismhr.com. Please indicate in the subject line of your email that you are requesting accommodation. Only candidates being considered for a position who require an accommodation will receive a follow-up response.*

title: Oracle Customer Experience & Service Solution Architect
description:
**JOB SUMMARY:**


Principal Solutions Architect at Argano plays a crucial role in bridging the gap between sales, delivery, and the client, ensuring that the solutions proposed are both feasible and valuable. The Architect interacts with the sales and delivery teams to estimate, scope and architect the solutions for clients and prospective clients. They require a high level of functional and potentially technical expertise in their area of expertise. They are responsible for overseeing and guiding the architectural aspects of mid to large size projects as well as providing input into sales strategy and execution pre-sale. They develop models that illustrate how a product/solution provides value to customers and they will scope, estimate and propose on the solution(s) they develop, and further assist the delivery team in detailed definition and design during implementation. Having broad expertise or unique knowledge, uses skills to contribute to development of company objectives and principles and to achieve goals in creative and effective ways.


**RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Maintain thorough understanding of current and planned applications, tools and technologies related to the Argano 4 Oracle supported platforms and tools.
* Lead Project solution design through implementations, overseeing critical milestones.
* Complete RFP responses
* Work with the sales team to drive sales cycles to completion.
* Promptly communicating, engaging, and acting appropriately to remedy client satisfaction issues occurring before, during and after an engagement, escalating to the PMO as necessary
* Utilizing entrepreneurial skills to network and building strong relationships internally and externally with clients and the Oracle Cloud community
* Meeting with client to advocate for process improvements to their existing business processes. Leading strategic business process transformation sessions and conversations to identify opportunities for improvement related to people, process, or technology.
* Lead design meetings with clients to identify their business process requirements and technical needs to determine proper solution for implementation.
* Architect the overall proposed solution and implementation strategy
* Collaborate with the sales team to facilitate information gathering sessions for both product demonstration and functional scoping purposes.
* Perform quality control on estimates and Statements of Work related to scope, project drivers, assumptions, complimentary and competing initiatives, and critical path items.
* Participate in defining and delivering project proposals and estimates, statements of work and implementation strategies.
* Communicate product information and provide guidance to clients and coworkers on issues, tools and techniques, enhancements, changes in processes and related information.
* Provide technical insight for proposal responses, RFPs, and other documentation.


**MINIMUM AND/OR PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:**


EDUCATION:


* Bachelor’s Degree preferred.


EXPERIENCE:


* Ability to manage/deliver large projects, including experience planning and estimating preferred.
* Validated ability to support sales as Subject Matter Expert
* Understanding of business-related drivers and parameters
* Ability to understand fundamental Oracle CX implementations, including Sales & Service Cloud and Field Service.
* Design and present end-to-end Oracle Field Service solutions, encompassing service territories, resource pools, and work zones, that align with client needs and strategic goals.
* Extensive experience with Field Service Management or Workforce Management solutions.
* 10+ years of experience in Oracle Presales, Solution Architect or technical sales roles for enterprise CX SaaS applications preferably Oracle Cloud.
* Experience working in senior technical roles such as enterprise architect, solution architect, solution lead, functional team lead.
* Experience working directly with large-scale enterprise clients and/or supporting sales, and success teams.
* Experience in B2B, B2C Services business across the industry vertical
* Experience working in Oracle Field service projects that delivered the full lifecycle of analysis, design, software development, architecture, integration, testing and deployments.
* Experience with and comfortable presenting to large client groups.
* Perform the effort estimation for implementing complex Oracle solutions.
* Build technical documentation, diagrams, demos, and proofs of concept to support client solutions, with a consultative approach to identifying existing and prospective client needs and articulating Argano’s technical value proposition.
* Stay updated on industry trends and product roadmap for Oracle Field service/related CX solutions.
* Provide transition knowledge to Argano delivery teams.
* Foster strong relationships with Oracle to drive innovation and keep abreast of application changes and upgraded functionality.
* Collaborate with the entire pre-sales team to build and maintain an integrated Argano Oracle CX demo environment.
* Willing to travel as necessary


CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS**:**


* Oracle certified preferred.


SKILL REQUIREMENTS


* **Advanced Technical Proficiency:** Mastery of multiple technology stacks, platforms, and frameworks, expertise in designing highly complex and scalable solutions.
* **Programming:** Proficiency in various programming languages and the ability to understand and write code.
* **Solution Design Leadership:** The ability to lead projects in creating complex solution designs.
* **Client Engagement:** Strong client-facing skills, acting as a trusted advisor to clients and providing deep technical consultancy.
* **Quality Assurance:** Ensuring the highest standards of quality, performance, and security in architectural designs.
* **Strategic Thinking:** Strategic problem-solving and the ability to align technical architecture with long-term business goals.
* **Multitasking:** Overseeing multiple projects, resource allocation, and timeline management for a portfolio of complex initiatives.
* **Innovation:** Proven track record of proposing and implementing innovative solutions that drive business success.
* **Teamwork:** Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, including developers, engineers, project managers, and other architects.


The base compensation range for this position is $140,000 - $210,000 commensurate with experience. Argano also offers a performance-based bonus and strong benefits package including Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, Paid Parental Leave and Flexible Time Off.

title: Sales Engineer, Salesforce
description:
**Role:** Sales Engineer


***\\*\\*\\*Hands on Salesforce platform experience and/or certification required for this role\\*\\*\\****


**Description:** As a Sales Engineer, you will be a resource for Australia and PST based Account Executives to assist in increasing velocity and successfully closing Blackthorn deals. This is an individual contributor role that should be ready to roll up their sleeves.


**Base Salary:** $130,000USD +


**What you'll do**


* Conduct daily learning calls for Account Executives to ask questions
* Create and share common Salesforce solutions for gaps in the Blackthorn product
* Be a technical/product expert resource on sales calls with prospects
* Create examples of prospects and customer use cases in the shared demo org.
* Work internally with security resources to complete documents in a timely manner
* Conduct and execute demos by effectively navigating prospects through our product
* Compile all that is needed to produce a clean and polished final RFP, RFI, RFQ proposal
* Create success plans prior to closed won deals for a smooth transition to Customer Success and Onboarding teams


**What we look for**


* 2+ years of working for a B2B SaaS company
* 2+ years of consulting in a Salesforce ecosystem
* 2+ years of Sales Engineer experience (working with AEs on demos)
* Salesforce certified admin
* Has previously configured and demoed Salesforce product to end-users
* Has previously owned the completion of RFP's (requirement docs, security docs, proposals)

 **What we offer**


* An incredible team of smart and supportive people
* A deep feeling of satisfaction and completion
* Fully remote global team working from home
* Stock options to every employee (We are ALL owners)
* Four day work week (Actually a thing)
* $400 office stipend
* Maternity/Paternity leave
* Student loan debt assistance
* Pledge 1% - time off during the year for helping nonprofits
* Health insurance contribution (if in the US)
* Children's 529 college fund assistance (if in the US)


**About Blackthorn**



We have five native apps on the Salesforce AppExchange for managing Events, collecting Payments, sending Messages, protecting Data, and showcasing a virtual Storefront. We're a growing, distributed team in four countries. We move fast and have significant structure in our product build process. Everyone on our team has deep experience within their respective roles. Our customers span from 1 person companies to Fortune 500s.


**Why is our work important**



Our apps continue to be easy to use and setup, due to continuous refinements with our UX. Most apps in our space take weeks to implement, ours take hours, and they work more flexibly, achieving significantly more functionality than our competitors. We believe enterprise apps should be as easy to use as consumer mobile apps.


**What the job will bring you**



A deep level of satisfaction through ownership of your role. You'll get more autonomy than at other companies (we've been told by our team). Connection. Our team is tightly knit, assisted through our annual company trip (as we're remote). Challenge. We're trying to move as quick as possible. This is not for you if you want to sit back and chill. As Ray Dalio says about life: "Meaningful work and meaningful relationships" provide meaning to life. We aim to bring this.
