title: Sr. Solution Engineer, AWS
description:
### **About NeuraFlash:**



We are a leading AI and Consulting Partner of Amazon & Salesforce obsessed with helping our customers transform their contact centers with AI Powered Experiences. Our expertise spans across the Amazon ecosystem with Amazon Connect, Lex & Contact Lens and Salesforce ecosystem with Service Cloud Voice, Einstein Bots and Digital Channels, Service Cloud, Field Service, CPQ, MuleSoft, and Einstein Analytics. We are experts in building experiences grounded in data that transform and optimize the employee and customer journey.


### **What sets NeuraFlash apart?**



At NeuraFlash, our people form the core of our business and the soul of our brand. We hire individuals who inspire us and look at challenges as opportunities to create innovative solutions. You'll be provided with ongoing education and development opportunities via our Salesforce Partnership Program and mentorship programs created for our aspiring leaders. NeuraFlash is on the forefront of cutting-edge technologies and we understand by investing in you, we're investing in ourselves!


NeuraFlash is growing and hiring a Solution Engineer specializing in Amazon Connect & Service Cloud Voice Solutions! As a member of our Solution Engineering team, you'll be heavily involved in the pre-sales process for a variety of cutting-edge technology projects primarily within the AWS Connect ecosystem, Salesforce Service Cloud Voice, Digital Channels, AI & more! Working closely with and reporting to our Director of Solution Engineering, you will be responsible for demonstrating and creating value for NeuraFlash services and products for Amazon Connect & Salesforce Service Cloud Voice, building technical credibility in compelling demonstrations, and creating accurate and competitive proposals for projects.



As a Solution Engineer, you'll contribute to our Amazon Connect product strategy, and Service Cloud Voice product development efforts. As a Solution Engineer, you will collaborate closely with our AWS and Salesforce Practice Leads to establish a best-in-class pre-sales process to provide high growth and penetration into key accounts in the AWS & Salesforce ecosystem.


### **YOU'LL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO:**


* Demonstrate Amazon, Salesforce and NeuraFlash products/assets to customers
* Lead discovery sessions, presentations and workshops with prospects and customers
* Gather requirements for large-scale contact center digital transformation projects
* Create compelling demos and deliver to customers and prospects, showcasing the power of the Amazon & Salesforce platform and the value of NeuraFlash as a Consulting Partner
* Create and modify Proposals SOW's and create responses to RFP's
* Help maintain and update lead management, pipeline & forecasting in Salesforce
* Be liaison between the sales and the technical team to improve efficiency in customer sales responses and product improvements
* Nurture relationships with Amazon, Salesforce and our customers to continue to establish NeuraFlash as a trusted partner
* Collaborate closely with delivery on project scope & estimates and execute our pre-sales process to the highest degree
* Provide customer feedback and solutions to product management to continue to advance our portfolio of products
* Continuously ensure the highest possible level of customer experience

### **REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:**


* 2 - 3 years experience selling telephony solutions such as Amazon Connect, Genesys, Five9, Vonage, New Voice Media, NICE inContact, TalkDesk, etc. (preferably Amazon Connect or a similar cloud-based telephony solution)
* 2 - 3 years in customer facing role, preference for Pre-Sales/Solution Engineering experience
* 1 - 2 years in a consulting role (preferably)
* BS in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or similar technical degree or equivalent experience

### **PREFERRED SKILLS:**


* Expert understanding of contact center telephony solutions, specifically Amazon Connect/Service Cloud Voice or a similar solution
* Solid understanding of the AWS and Salesforce platforms/architectures
* A keen interest in learning rapidly in the Generative AI Space
* Strong customer facing skills
* Attention towards detail
* Team player
* Great communication skills
* Passion to succeed and drive the company forward
* Open-minded and flexible to change

### **What's it like to be a part of NeuraFlash?**


* Remote & In-Person: Whether you work out of our HQ in Massachusetts, one of our regional hubs, our India office, or you're one of over half of our NeuraFlash Family who work remotely, we're focused on keeping everyone connected and unified as one team.
* Travel: Get ready to pack your bags and hit the road! For certain roles, travel is an exciting part of the job, with an anticipated travel commitment of up to 25%. So, if you have a passion for adventure and don't mind a little jet-setting, this opportunity could be your ticket to exploring new places while making a positive impact on clients.
* Flexibility: Do you have to take the dog to the vet, pick up the kids from school, or the in-laws from the airport? We know that a perfect 9-5 isn't possible. So you have to jump out to do any of those, no problem! We build a culture of trust and understanding. We value good work not the hours in which you get it done
* Collaboration: You have a voice here! If you work with a team of smart people like we do, it's a no-brainer to take suggestions and feedback on how to keep NeuraFlash thriving. Our executive team holds town halls & company meetings where they address any suggestions or questions asked, no matter how big or small.
* Celebrate Often: We take our work seriously, but we don't take ourselves too seriously. Whether it is an arm wrestling contest, costume party, or ugly holiday sweaters our teams love to have fun. And while we work hard, we don't forget to slow down and celebrate the big things and the small things together.

### **The "Flashy" Perks:**


* Be in the right space: Work at the forefront of AI & Innovation on the Salesforce and AWS Platforms.
* Growth: In 2023, we grew our team by 21%, and we plan to do the same again this year! There's no limit to where your career at NeuraFlash can go.
* L&D Program: We are invested in your success. This program was built to help our employees advance in their career in Salesforce and at NeuraFlash.
* The Buddy Program: Each new team member is assigned a mentor to help them acclimate at NeuraFlash.
* Monthly & Weekly Socials: We hold monthly & weekly virtual socials to have more opportunities to be together.


*Location: NeuraFlash strives to provide you with the flexibility to work in the location that makes the most sense for your lifestyle. For those that prefer an office setting, this role may be based in any of our hub locations within the United States, and India. If you prefer to work from your home, we can accommodate remote locations anywhere in the United States for our U.S. based employees, anywhere within British Columbia and Ontario for our Canadian employees, and anywhere within Colombia for our Colombian based employees!*

title: Sales Engineer, Remote USA
description:
This is a remote position and can be located anywhere in the United States, West Coast preferred.
  
  

AS THE WORLD MOVES TO FHIR, THERE ARE PLENTY OF REASONS TO SMILE.
  
  

Smarter decisions, fewer barriers, and better incentives are just the beginning. Smile Digital Health makes it easy for healthcare stakeholders to collect and exchange data with our leading FHIR-based data liberation platform.
  
  

We reduce barriers between information and care for those who deliver or consume health services and products and whose roles or care are hindered by fractured, inaccessible or complex information systems.
  
  

Let’s make a difference!
  
  

BE PART OF THE TEAM WORKING TOWARDS #BETTERGLOBALHEALTH
  
  

This role will be responsible for assisting in shaping and delivering on the Health Data Fabric (HDF) anchored in Smile Digital Health’s FHIR platform. As a trusted Sales Engineer, you will help Clients and prospective customers understand the full breadth, technical and, business details of Smile’s solutions through custom Proof of Concept (PoC), presentations, demonstrations and, support the development and response of RFPs by detailing adoption and migration of existing systems and data to the Smile platform.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Act as a trusted technical advisor to prospect and existing customers by determining and analyzing complex technical product functionality gaps, and collaborating with various internal teams to develop solutions that meet customer expectations.
* Develop strong relationships with varying levels of the client and maintain up-to-date knowledge of business objectives, vision and goals to determine ROI, opportunities and product requirement(s).
* Proactively lead the customer on their buy Journey by understanding and anticipating their needs and pain points and offering impactful, persuasive solutioning.
* Provide scoping and sandbox environment support and substantiate business and technical solutions offered to existing and prospective clients.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and demonstrate ROI based on technical product capabilities that align with client business objectives and goals.
* Creating high-level IT architecture specifications and design documents along with troubleshooting and resolving issues with design.
* Identify solutions for existing challenges or obstacles and anticipate potential future challenges.
* Support the design and migration of data to Smile’s platform while being sensitive to the customer’s business model and cultural transformation towards a Smile Health Data Fabric.
* Support and contribute to customer proposals and closing by preparing and delivering technical presentations explaining products and services to prospective customers through technical and product demonstrations, presentations and on-going technical consultation.
* Support the development of Sales and Account Management strategies by providing technical expertise.
* Act as a technical liaison between customers, service engineering teams, product teams and support.
* Rapidly develop and maintain a deep knowledge of Smile’s products, FHIR, market trends and customer environment.
* Collaborate cross-functionally to continuously improve product, sales and marketing.
* Comply with the privacy, security and confidentiality policies.


**Requirements:**  

* Min of 5 years of experience leading business development, technical sales and/or customer consulting as well as contributing to the system design or architecture (architecture, design patterns, reliability, and scaling) of new and current systems.
* Experience in healthcare, technology or a similar industry, is preferred.
* Professional software development experience is preferred.
* Significant hands-on experience in implementation and customer consulting.
* Experience building complex technology-based systems that have been successfully delivered to customers, particularly at scale.
* Ability to take a project from scoping requirements through the launch of the project.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain complex technical software product features, technical designs, product strategy, and intended solutions.
* Demonstrate ability to present and influence all levels of an organization up to and including C-level/Executive level.
* Previous experience leading and/or senior-level contributions to strategic RFP response development.
* Knowledge of professional software development practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.
* Experience providing support to new hires and colleagues to improve their skills and help elevate the effectiveness of the overall team and company.
* Knowledge of at least one major CSP and deployment patterns including CI/CD, container, orchestration, IaaS scripting and architecting.
* Knowledge and/ or experience in modern programming tools and development patterns such as microservices architecture, scalable enterprise, etc.
* Experience with health technologies (i.e. HL7 FHIR) is highly preferred.


Smile's core values include respect, inclusion, embracing our differences, and celebrating shared values and because our people are the foundation of our success, we remain dedicated to building diverse and inclusive teams. We are big on creating a sense of belonging and empowering each other to bring our authentic selves to work. We welcome and encourage candidates of all backgrounds to apply. We are dedicated to fostering a workplace that values diversity, equity, and inclusion. Candidates are encouraged to inform us if they wish to discuss or require accommodations during interviews or while working at Smile.

title: D365 F&SCM Solution Architect
description:
**JOB SUMMARY:**  

ArganoArbela is looking to hire an experienced Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&SCM – Solution Architect with recent Dynamics 365 Finance & Supply Chain (Microsoft Dynamics AX) experience to join its large Microsoft Dynamics practice. As a member of the professional services team, you will be working closely and effectively with our customers and responsible for reviewing clients’ business process, providing solid analysis, assessing solutions, and advising our customers on how to best meet their goals.


We are looking for strong professionals with deep industry experience in the following areas:


* Finance
* Procurement/Purchasing
* Customer service (Sales and Marketing)
* Inventory management
* Warehouse & Transportation Management
* Master planning
* Production execution
* Project Management and Accounting


A successful Solution Architect candidate should have very good experience in at least 3 indicated areas above, have a proven deep industry knowledge and ability to independently manage projects and deliver solutions directly to the customer. Candidates should have recent experience implementing Dynamics 365, a good understanding of Microsoft ALM stack (LCS, BPM, VSTS), Microsoft implementation best practices (Success by Design) and existing technologies (Azure, AX connectors, PowerApps).


**Responsibilities:**


* Participates in every aspect of the solution implementation from analyzing the customer’s business requirements to configuring and testing the Microsoft Dynamics application to meet the customer’s needs.
* Collaborates with stakeholders throughout the organization to ensure a comprehensive set of requirements, aligned to business objectives, gaining full understanding of current business processes, and identifying opportunities for improvements.
* Provides in-depth knowledge of the Microsoft Dynamics application and evaluates the customer’s business processes against the standard Microsoft Dynamics functionality.
* Responsible for following Arbela Agile Implementation methodology; understands the key activities and deliverables for the client engagement and internal projects, reuses all standard templates and project artifacts and improves quality of Arbela documentation assets.
* Fully utilizes Microsoft Technology and ALM stack (LCS, BPM, VSTS, Task guides, PowerApps, Office 365, etc.).
* Provides ongoing input to the delivery practice through suggestions and implementations of practice improvements.
* Responsible for documenting the business requirements which express what actions a solution must take and what outcome is expected.
* Responsible for configuring and customizing the Microsoft Dynamics application to achieve the customer’s business requirements.
* If modifications/customizations are required, either to processes or to the Microsoft Dynamics application, the Solution Architect facilitates the customer’s decision-making process and reviews the functional design document that will drive the development process.
* Plans and oversees the execution of the CRPs and UATs in collaboration with the project manager and gathers early user feedback on the solution from key customer stakeholders. Validates that the solution will satisfy the customer’s requirements after a POC or UAT.
* Responsible for contributing valuable assets into Arbela Knowledge base, Implementation methodology toolbox and in marketing activities including blogging and sharing knowledge articles.
* Has deep industry experience and understands challenges and risks when implementing Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&SCM and Vertical applications.


In addition, a Solution Architect will be responsible for:


* Contributes to the scope management, risk management, meaning identification, evaluation, and mitigation plan.
* Helps drive the work estimation to realize the implementation of the proposed solution.
* Supports the Implementation Team through the development and implementation phase of the project to handle solution-oriented topics.
* Demonstrates strong qualitative analytic capabilities, particularly in relevant strategy formulation areas such as client, industry, and management issues/challenges.
* Demonstrates ability to plan and manage engagement work and allocate resources appropriately under time, quality, and budget constraints.
* Contributes to company growth and revenue generation through identification and proactive pursuit of new revenue opportunities.
* Works collaboratively with practice leadership team to grow, develop and enhance solution best practices, tools and methods, and intellectual property.
* Mentors the team of functional consultants, provides functional support and knowledge sharing.


**Minimum and/or Preferred Qualifications:**

EDUCATION:


* Bachelor’s degree in information systems management, Computer Science, or related experience
* Successful completion of Microsoft Certified: Dynamics 365: Finance and Operations Apps Solution Architect Expert certification.


EXPERIENCE:


* Senior level consulting experience in Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&SCM application with focus on business modeling and solutions implementation.
* Candidate should have at least 4+ years of Microsoft Dynamics implementation experience and have participated in a minimum of 3 complete life cycle implementations.
* Candidate should also have experience in D365 F&SCM implementation, Business process modelling, utilizing main LCS tools.
* Good understanding of existing Microsoft ALM stack and experience using it.
* Ability to use ADO as a consulting task tracking tool.
* Complete understanding and following Process-driven implementation approach.
* Demonstrated ability to:
	+ Analyze and understand business problems.
	+ Apply high-level solution architecture and design (Functional and/or Technical)
	+ Analyze, understand, and dissect business processes and re-engineer with best practices.
	+ Document and capture business requirements and processes properly.
	+ Model data and processes.
	+ Plan and assist with data migration processes.
	+ Conduct workshops and training sessions.
	+ Plan and carry out system and user acceptance testing.
	+ Provide customer focused support.
* Familiar and experienced in:
	+ Core application functionality.
	+ Application technology stack
	+ Implementation Methodology
	+ Deep Industry Knowledge and Best practices
* Working knowledge of process development and industry specific best practices
* High degree of insight and analytical skill
* Ability to work independently, prioritize and solve problems proactively.
* Creative problem solving and conflict resolution.
* Excellent facilitation, discovery, analysis, and prototyping skills
* Team-oriented; willing to align work with team’s priorities and goals.
* Creates high-quality deliverables.
* Excellent communication, presentation, training, client relationship and analytical skills.
* Places emphasis on project value and client satisfaction


**Additional Preferred Skills & Considerations:**


* Experience in solution architecture is highly desirable.
* Good understanding and experience in implementation project and engagement management
* Experience in upgrading to the latest releases of Dynamics 365 F&O
* Experience in providing pre- and post-sales support for MS Dynamics is considered a plus.
* Experience with other modules is also desirable.
* Strong work ethic: Ability to work in a non-structured work environment.
* Excellent interpersonal, presentation and written communication skills
* Self-Starter with ability to handle multiple tasks and shifting priorities.
* Solve complex problems with creative solutions.
* Learn new concepts quickly and thoroughly.
* Directly interacts with customers to resolve conflicts and issues with the goal of improving and maintaining positive relationships.
* Requires the ability to change the thinking of or gain acceptance from others in sensitive situations without damage to the relationship.
* Demonstrated experience presenting and interfacing with C-level executives.
* Demonstrate strong analytical and problem-solving skills, particularly with regard to anticipating and solving problems or issues before they occur or become critical.
* Good time management, well-organized, consistently meets commitments and creates high-level deliverables.
* Ability to solve complex problems with little to no guidance.
* Ability to work in a constantly changing environment with limited direction.
* A strong work ethic and ability to be a self-starter.
* Service oriented and positive attitude.


The base compensation range for this position in the United States is $139,000 - $188,000 commensurate with experience. Argano also offers a performance-based bonus and strong benefits package including Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, Paid Parental Leave and Flexible Time Off.

title: Consulting Solutions Architect
description:
**THE ROLE: Consulting Solutions Architect.**

**Position: Full time**

**Location: Milwaukee, WI** 

**Travel: 25%**

**Experience: 7+ yrs**

**Job Summary:**

As a Consulting Solutions Architect (CSA) you will play a critical role in the Milwaukee area.

The role of the CSA is to provide a business focused approach and high touch engagement with a select number of high profile accounts.

The CSA evangelizes Presidio product offerings and new vendor technologies within those select customers.

The CSA is primarily responsible for uncovering new opportunities with the customer, quarterbacking multiple concurrent technical initiatives and developing the trusted advisor role with the assigned accounts.

Additionally, the CSA maintains our market beating pre-sales capabilities, drives the expansion of our services business and aligns appropriately with our vendor partners in those assigned clients.

The Consulting Solution Architect is responsible for supporting our clients, our sales teams, our pre-sales teams and our services teams with excellent technical and services knowledge in a highly professional, efficient and always constructive manner.

**Travel Requirements:**

This position involves up to 25% travel in the region. It will be based in the Milwaukee, WI area.

**Job Responsibilities:**

Full understanding of the customer business model, strategy, and objectives

Full understanding of the customer metrics for measuring success, both at the individual and at the corporate level

Be in total agreement with your account manager for strategy in covered account(s)

Establish bi-weekly or monthly account review sessions with AM’s

Gains the trust of assigned accounts through technical relationship building, undoubted integrity, ability to lead and constant professionalism

Be able to message Presidio’s entire portfolio of offerings, our capabilities and position Presidio’s broad solutions set

Drives services and product sales across all areas either through primary knowledge or through the assistance of subject matter experts.

Provide strategic consulting and advice to our primary assigned clients

Be the technical lead on all multi-practice engagements

Provide thought leadership to our clients as they operate and transform their businesses.

Update SFDC with relevant account information and activity

Be involved, on a regular basis, onsite with assigned clients

Engage proactively with assigned accounts, including initiation of strategic meetings

**Required Skills:**

Self motivated

Excellent communication skills & public speaking ability

One or more of the following:

Thorough understanding of Networking Architecture, Cloud Networking, and Network Automation

Thorough understanding of Data Center Software Defined Architecture

Thorough understanding of Collaboration Systems and Architecture

Thorough understanding of Security Frameworks and their applicable use cases

**Additional Desired Skills:**

Al/ML Understanding

Observability

Cloud Hyper-Scaler

**Education and Experience:**

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience and/or military experience

7+ years of overall relevant experience including 5+ years of experience in Pre-Sales, Consulting, Enterprise Architecture design OR 5+ years of experience as a technology executive.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: Up to $190,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Health insurance

Compensation package:

* Bonus opportunities
* Yearly pay

Experience level:

* 7 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* Computer networking: 5 years (Preferred)
* Pre-sales: 5 years (Required)
* Business consulting: 5 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Sales Engineer - Technical Sales
description:
**Dartronics, Inc. offers a guaranteed base salary plus unlimited commission, mileage and tole are covered, comprehensive medical coverage, and a 401k**  

  

We are looking for a **New England Sales Representative** for technical sales with a drive to make money, outgoing, likable, mechanically inclined, and, most importantly, a solution provider!  

**Training:**
The Sales Rep will learn about our products while accessing thousands of hot leads from our vast database. We also participate in multiple trade shows annually and have extensive print media advertising circulation. With our elite machinery and reputation, sales leads come to us!  

**Requirements:*** ***MUST BE LOCATED IN THE NEW ENGLAND AREA!***
* Technical Degree
* Sales Driven - The desire to sell and make money.
* Outgoing and likable
* Mechanically inclined
* Proficiency in Windows-based programs

**Responsibilities:*** Business-to-business capital goods selling environment to all levels of a company (President, Operations, Purchasing, Maintenance)
* Outstanding organizational and communication skills, both verbal and written, to work with a wide range of customers
* Proven ability to grow existing customer accounts while hunting for new opportunities/customers by creative sourcing and cold calling.
* Strong analytical skills to explain and demonstrate cost reductions and operational improvements
* Ability to "think outside the box" to develop customer service requirements and implement total solutions
* Cold calling is mandatory.

  

***Who is Dartronics, Inc.?*** DARTRONICS is a 25-plus year leading provider of packaging equipment and automation solutions in the Tri-State Area. Dartronics is a System Integrator. Our portfolio of product offerings includes inkjet printers, labelers, case sealers, flow wrappers, stretch wrappers, conveyors, vision systems, scanners, case erectors, case packers, and more, focusing on the last 100 feet of a production line.

title: Pre-Sales Engineer
description:
**Pre-Sales Engineer (Solutions Architect)**

**Location:** Remote (USA)


**Compensation:** $90,000 + Equity


**Experience Level:** 3 years +


**About the Company:**

Our client, a prominent force in the technology sector, is seeking a Solutions Architect with expertise in Pre-Sales Engineering. Founded in 2017, this company is a trailblazer in utilizing AI-powered predictive analytics to safeguard critical infrastructure globally, with a specific focus on the energy sector. Backed by leading investors, they collaborate with major players in the industry, leading with unparalleled accuracy in AI solutions.


**Responsibilities:**

* Act as the technical lead during the sales cycle, collaborating closely with the Account Executive to secure the technical win.
* Key responsibilities include technical scoping, conducting demos, and executing Proof of Concepts (POCs).
* Work closely with the Account Executive to understand client needs and align technical solutions with the company's cutting-edge AI-powered platform for the energy sector.
* Bridge the technical and business aspects of the sales process, emphasizing the advantages of AI in critical infrastructure within the energy sector.
* Showcase the value proposition of the company through compelling presentations, focusing on the platform's AI accuracy and predictive analytics capabilities.
* Offer technical expertise and support to clients throughout the sales journey.
* Collaborate with internal teams to ensure a seamless transition from sales to implementation.
* Stay abreast of industry trends in AI, ML, and tech solutions within the energy sector to enhance the sales approach.
* Continuously improve knowledge of the company's AI-powered platform.

**Requirements:**

* Demonstrated proficiency with a minimum of 4 years in Pre-Sales or Solution Engineering within a B2B technology software environment.
* Holds a relevant degree or equivalent.
* Proven success in supporting the sales team in selling advanced technology solutions to technical stakeholders throughout the sales process.
* Quick adaptability to understand and master intricate and innovative technologies and products.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Ability to lead and collaborate with internal teams.
* Comfortable participating in technical discussions around AI and ML.

**Note:** Candidates must be authorized to work in the U.S. Visa sponsorship cannot be provided at this time.

title: Solutions Architect (Los Angeles)
description:
**About Us:**
-------------

  

Join the team at OpenDrives, a rapidly growing data services company that is dedicated to solving complex technology problems with innovative yet practical solutions. Our customers range from Hollywood blockbusters, to medical imaging specialists, to academia, and everything in between. Our company's core values are summed up in the word OPEN, which stands for open-mindedness, persistence, effectiveness, and nimbleness. We are looking for empathetic, self-starting professionals who are passionate about exceeding customer expectations and who thrive in a collaborative, supportive environment. If you're a curious listener, with a commitment to excellence, and want to be part of an organization that is dedicated to solving real-world data management challenges, we invite you to apply to join our team today.

  

**About the Role:**
-------------------


**While this job is mostly remote, we are looking for a Solutions Architect based in the Los Angeles Metropolitan Area**. **The Solutions Architect (Lose Angeles) is expected to travel occasionally for lab testing at our Culver City HQ and co-locations** as well as for customer visits and industry events domestically and internationally.


At OpenDrives, the pre-sales Solutions Architect is a trusted expert in (Network Attached Storage )NAS technologies with an emphasis in the media and entertainment industry. This individual will play a pivotal role as part of the “Solutions Team” within the overarching Product department, with a focus on analyzing, qualifying, and certifying OpenDrives' products with other industry standards, hardware, and software technologies. This position involves close collaboration with various internal departments, along with external channel and alliance partners, to establish optimal practices and recommendations for OpenDrives and our partners/resellers. The goal is to ensure that both parties can effectively deliver top-notch solutions that meet our customers' workflow and business requirements with confidence.


**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**
------------------------------------------


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the following satisfactorily; other duties may be assigned. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  

* **Must live in the Los Angeles Metropolitan area**
* Drive analysis, qualification, and/or certification of OpenDrives software and services with other third-party offerings through the creation of test plans, testing, and validation of success criteria.
* Create proven workflow solutions and integrations that enable the “Technical Win” for pre-sales opportunities and ease the support burden on our post sales and support teams, including creation of diagrams and collateral as well as participation in Proof of Concept (POC) technical activities.
* Build relationships and become a trusted technology adviser to internal departments, alliance partners, and channel partners, through collaboration, training, and teamwork.
* Competency with industry trends, competition, and emerging technologies to effectively position our offerings in the market and guide our future development roadmap.
* Collaborate with the Product and Marketing teams to plan and execute releases, campaigns, webinars, and events highlighting the technical advantages and integrations of OpenDrives' solutions.

  

  

**Expertise:**
--------------

**The following technical expertise is a must:**


* Media applications and workflows (e.g. NLE, Color, broadcast, VFX, OTT).
* High performance physical storage systems and related hardware components, with Docker and Kubernetes experience a definite plus.
* File systems and network protocols (e.g. ZFS, Lustre, SMB, NFS, S3), with advanced networking protocols (RoCE, NFSoRDMA, SMBDirect, & GPUDirect) a definite plus
* Hands-on experience with Linux, MacOS, and Windows administration, deployment, and command line tools, with Docker and Kubernetes experience a definite plus.
* Familiarity with networking, switches, and switch configurations (e.g. NVIDIA, Arista, LACP, MLAG, VLAN).
* Understanding of media terminology (e.g. codecs, resolutions, frame rate, bit depth, RAW, compression).


**Competencies and Skills:**
----------------------------


To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following:


* Self-starter with a customer focus and a strong hands-on, “can do” approach and with an attention to detail and time management.
* Solutions-focused with a passion for empathetic and collaborative solving problems through technology and design solutions that meet customer needs.
* Strong written, oral, and presentation skills with the ability to effectively discuss highly technical concepts to a variety of audiences, including the executive level, and help develop technical assets.


**Education and Experience:**
-----------------------------


* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or a related technical field.
* 2-5 years of proven experience as a Solutions Architect, Sales Engineer, Technical Marketing Engineer, or in a similar pre-sales technical role in the NAS data storage industry.


**Physical Demands:**
---------------------


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and use hands to finger, handle, or feel. The employee is frequently required to talk or hear; stand and walk. The employee must be able to occasionally lift and/or move up to 65 pounds.

  

**Work Environment:**
---------------------


The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.This job operates partially in a clerical, office setting, but also includes on-site visits to customer locations and industry events.


The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.


**Benefits**
------------


We have some awesome perks if you want to work with us.


* Incredible vacation policy and flexible schedule
* Great health, dental, and vision insurance
* Employer and Employee Paid Life Insurance & AD&D Options
* Voluntary Short & Long Term Disability Options
* Flexible Spending Account/Health Savings Account Options
* Employee Assistance Program
* 401(k)
* Cell Phone and Internet Allowance
* Options for hybrid remote/office work, or full remote
* A culture of empathy and empowerment


**Pay Scale Disclaimer**
------------------------


The hiring salary range for this role is $125,000.00- $175,000.00 USD annually.


Please note that the compensation information provided is a good faith estimate for this position only and is provided pursuant to the California Salary Transparency in Job Advertisements Law. OpenDrives takes into consideration a candidate's education, training, and experience, external market and internal value, including seniority and merit systems, and internal pay alignment when determining the salary level for potential new employees. In compliance with the California Law, a potential new employee's salary history will not be used in compensation decisions.

title: IT Support & Sales Engineer - Helpdesk ServiceDesk (Work from home)
description:
**=== ARE YOU OUR NEXT TEAM MEMBER? ===**

  


Do you love technology, creating solutions for customers, and providing excellent experiences? Do you thrive in a fast paced, technical, client focused, and challenging position? Do you "fill your bucket" by helping others have a better day? Do you have experience in tech support, field support, customer service, or computer support? Yes? Great! keep reading!  

  

**== ABOUT US ===**  

  

Established in 2009, EasyITGuys is a family-owned technology company that has been providing exceptional IT services to a diverse range of clients. From families facing technology challenges to businesses with hundreds of employees. Headquartered in Polk County, Wisconsin, we extend our services to clients across the United States. Our commitment is to offer high-quality service and support, tailored IT solutions, and proactive cybersecurity measures. We embrace every day as an opportunity to be the best while having fun!  

  

Learn more about us at this links: About Us (mission, vision, company values), Client Ticket Surveys, and Public Reviews (Google, Facebook, BBB, Yelp)  

  

Connect with us: Facebook, Linkedin, Google, X (Twitter), and Instagram

  


**=== THE OPPORTUNITY ===**

  

**Type:** Hourly (Full-Time)  

**When:** Monday-Friday, 8AM to 4:30PM CST or 9AM - 5:30PM CST (depends on our current staff and needs)  

**Where:** Work from Home (BUSINESS or CONSULTANT TEAM)  

**What:** IT Sales and Support Engineer/Consultant/Specialist (Depends on team and role)  

**Day to Day:** In this role, you will play a pivotal role in delivering cutting-edge technologies to businesses with the occasional assistance to home users subscribed to our premium home support experience. Your daily tasks will include providing end-user support, recommending IT solutions, and addressing client dilemmas with innovative software solutions. The focus of your role is to ensure an exceptional IT experience for our clients, striking a balance between sales and support responsibilities throughout the work week. This role involves working closely with businesses, generally on a billable hourly rate, to solve their technical obstacles. Building and maintaining strong relationships with clients is a key aspect of the job. You will continuously expand your knowledge base, encountering new learning opportunities each day. Our commitment to a positive work-life balance complements the fast-paced nature of this role. Collaborate with us, and together, we can achieve anything!

  

**===REQUIRED SKILLS OR EXPERIENCE===**

  

* 3-5 years of related work experience at a MSP or MSSP
* Active Directory and Group Policy experience
* Strong Sales and Customer Relationship Skills
* Proficient with Windows Operating Systems, Microsoft Office, Windows Server and VPN Configuration
* Ability to troubleshoot software issues
* Office 365 proficient
* Excellent communications skills and the ability to instruct non-technical users
* Willingness to work as part of a team to deliver quality service to our clients
* Time management and task prioritization skills
* Experience performing onsite services and projects


**===BONUS POINTS - PREFERRED SKILLS===**


* Cisco/Datto switches and SonicWall/Watchguard Firewalls
* 60+ WPM
* Powershell and command line (scripting)
* Platform experience in: Auvik, Connectwise Automate, Connectwise Control, Acronis, Repairshopr, IT Glue
* ITIL best practices followed
* Certifications
* AS/BS Degree


**===WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT===**


* Generous Coverage for Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage
* Competitive Pay & Incentives (Profit Sharing)
* Experience Experience and more experience (did we say experience?)
* Room for promotion (Different support teams and positions)
* Small Business Experience (your opinion is heard and valued)
* Paid Time Off (Vacation/Sick Time/Personal Time)
* Paid Holidays
* 401K Plan
* Exciting and fast paced work environment
* Company Incentives and Perk programs


**We're located at 344 North Washington Street in downtown Saint Croix Falls, WI on highway 87. We are open Monday through Friday 10 A.M. to 6 P.M, and Saturdays from 10AM to 2PM**

title: Staff Solutions Engineer - East Region
description:
Upbound is the company behind Crossplane, the open source project which started the control plane revolution in the cloud native community. Upbound helps companies rise above the clouds with our Crossplane powered Universal Cloud Platform. With Upbound you get universal real-time visibility into all of your infrastructure environments, the same API centric approach Kubernetes pioneered for managing infrastructure and policies, and self service infrastructure capabilities.


As a Staff Solutions Engineer (SE) at Upbound, you'll be a vital part of our pre-sales team. This role will support all pre-sales GTM efforts in EST and CST regions across multiple segments. Once a lead is discovered and qualified, the Solutions Engineer works directly with the customer to understand the technical business problem they are trying to solve. They will help customers navigate and understand the value Upbound products and solutions bring them. Solutions Engineers build credible technical relationships with our customers by listening and then clearly communicating the value proposition of our products in a way that is contextualized to the customer's specific needs.



Solutions Engineers are deeply familiar with Upbound's product roadmap and will intuit when to sell ahead of our product roadmap and when to focus on existing solutions based on the customer's medium and long term vision. Solutions Engineers are expected to deeply understand the key technical and economic buyer's personalities and what it will take to get them to sign a deal.


**In this role, you can expect to be:**


* Partnering with a Sales Account Executive to engage in technical discussions with customers throughout the buying lifecycle.
* Working cross functionally with product marketing, and independently, to create and deliver high fidelity presentations, custom demos, sample solutions, and present use cases to guide the customer through the buying journey
* Closely partnering with customers and platform builders to solve technical and business challenges which enables them to design, build and implement Crossplane and Upbound Cloud based control plane architectures.
* Working directly with customers and platform builders to define, implement, and test out early proof of concepts of Crossplane and Upbound Cloud.
* Collect detailed customer requirements so product and engineering can accurately estimate and resource the necessary implementation services.
* The technical voice and trusted advisor to the customer and represent the customer needs internally.
* Project manage the account pre and post sale to ensure a smooth and frictionless customer experience through implementation in partnership with Solutions Architect and implementation teams.


**You are a good fit for this role if you have:**


* Guided customers through designing and deploying Kubernetes to their production environments.
* A deep understanding of highly scaled and reliable services, solutions, and infrastructure in multiple major cloud providers.
* Worked directly with customers and/or open source community members to troubleshoot and solve their complex technical issues preventing successful adoption.
* Deployed and integrated the projects and tools of the Cloud Native Landscape, especially CNCF projects, into production environments.
* A deep understanding of modern operational and application delivery tools and methodologies inside of production deployment workflows, like those from HashiCorp (e.g. Terraform), CI/CD, IaC, and GitOps.
* The ability to work closely with people in a wide variety of disciplines from a wide variety of backgrounds.
* Successfully managed multiple projects and priorities in a fast paced and dynamic environment.
* Successfully identified and removed friction from the buying process resulting in a more streamlined and shortened sales cycle.
* Excitement and comfort being a key part of further defining, scaling, and making this part of our sales process thrive.


**It is a plus if...**


* You are actively involved or have contributed to the upstream Kubernetes community.
* You have a history of speaking at technology conferences, blogging/writing technical articles, and/or contributing to a popular open source project.
* You have worked in a startup and distributed/remote team before, and understand the unique challenges of a startup environment.


While building amazing technology is important, Upbound has an intense commitment to building a great culture. With company values like Be Accountable, Demonstrate Craftsmanship, Champion the Customer, Collaborate Decisively, Care For Our Communities, Act as an Owner and Engage Vulnerability; you'll find yourself in a place where learning, growth, impact, and fun finally intersect. Similar to the open source community we serve, we look to each other to constantly iterate and improve on what we're building and you will be a key contributor in this effort.



We encourage people of all backgrounds, gender identities, ethnicities, ages, or any other descriptors that make you uniquely you, to apply with enthusiasm and confidence. Upbound is a place where you can be 100% comfortable being you.

title: Pre Sales Solution Architect
description:
**Location: Australia**


**About CoreView**


CoreView is the #1 Microsoft 365 management platform for Enterprise customers and MSPs who are transforming the way they run their Microsoft 365 stack. CoreView delivers a unified approach to configuration management, delegated administration, and automated governance with capabilities far beyond native tools or point products. Organizations of all sizes choose CoreView to command their operations, optimize tasks, refine governance strategies, and empower their workforce. CoreView empowers organizations to achieve more with Microsoft 365.


**About Simeon Cloud (a CoreView company)**


As businesses around the globe began migrating to Microsoft 365 for their data, collaboration, and productivity tools, they needed to ensure consistency across their environments. That meant hundreds of engineering hours to manually establish and maintain configurations.  

They needed a new solution.  

Simeon Cloud is that solution. We began with the simple idea that every engineering hour that could be automated could be saved for something more important. By eliminating up to 75% of manual configuration work, Simeon Cloud empowers clients and MSPs to reallocate valuable engineering resources while improving security.


**Job Description**


Are you ready to be a part of a dynamic team reshaping the technology industry through innovation? Then you could be the perfect fit for the Pre-Sales Solution Architect (PSA) role, here at CoreView. As a pre-sales solution architect covering both CoreView and Simeon Cloud, there are no limits to your growth or potential. Come aboard to redefine technology in the cloud, shape your future, and be a part of something truly groundbreaking.


**Responsibilities**


* Provide support to the sales and channel team members during the sales motion.
	+ Your territory will cover APAC
	+ You may also be asked to cover opportunities in the Middle East.
	+ The sales motion will include new business, upsells, and cross-sells
* Client Needs Assessment: Collaborate with the sales and channel teams to understand clients’ unique challenges and requirements, conducting in-depth needs assessments. Our clients include commercial customers and Managed Service Providers (MSPs) and we are able to address each of their pains and challenges.
* Technical Presentations: Conduct compelling technical presentations and demonstrations to showcase how our solutions meet clients’ needs, with a focus on benefits and value.
* Deliver webinars and represent CoreView and Simeon Cloud at marketing events
* Deliver proof of value exercises for CoreView and trials for Simeon Cloud for opportunities in your territory
* Client Engagement: Build strong relationships with channel partners by acting as a trusted advisor and providing support as needed to ensure their success in the sale and/or implementation of our solutions. This could include SIs, VADs, VARs and MSPs.
* Product Expertise: Serve as a product expert, staying up to date with our SaaS offerings' latest’ features and capabilities and ensuring a deep understanding of how they benefit clients.
* RFP Responses: Contribute to RFP responses by providing detailed technical content and ensuring alignment with client specifications.
* Cost Estimations: Collaborate with the sales team to estimate the costs associated with implementing our solution.
* Competitive Analysis: Stay informed about the competitive landscape and provide insight into how our solutions compare in terms of features, pricing, and value.
* Technical Documentation: Create and maintain technical documentation, architectural diagrams, and other relevant materials to support the sales process.

**Requirements**


* Bachelor's degree or relevant experience
* Minimum of 3 years working experience as a Solutions Architect in a sales or pre-sales role in the SaaS industry.
* Strong technical expertise
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical solutions to non-technical people
* Proven experience in designing and presenting technical solutions to clients.
* Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively within a dynamic team environment as well as independently.
* Knowledge of Microsoft 365 and Entra ID


**Desirable Skills**


* An understanding of hybrid Microsoft 365 environments (on-premise Active Directory)
* The ability to create scripts in PowerShell
* High level understanding of Azure DevOps


**Additional Notes**


* All Applicants will be required to take a pre-employment assessment for consideration.
* CoreView is an Affirmative Action, Equal Opportunity Employer that values the strength that diversity brings to the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against based on gender, race/ethnicity, protected veteran status, disability, or other protected group status.

title: Solutions Architect, Enterprise Networking
description:
**THE ROLE: Solutions Architect, Enterprise Networking.**

**Experience: 3 + yrs**

**Location: Grand Rapids, MI, or Lansing, MI**

**Position: Fulltime**

**Job Summary:**

We are looking to add a skilled Enterprise Networking and/or Security focused Solutions Architect to join our team from either the Grand Rapids, MI or Lansing, MI areas.

As a member of the Pre-Sales Engineering Team, you will be responsible for meeting with Presidio’s customers, collecting requirements for business solutions related to network and security projects, and developing engineering solutions for sale to Presidio customers. A successful Solutions Architect (SA) should be able to present and explain various technologies to customers, guide them through requirements gathering, and formulate a solution consisting of hardware, software, licensing, and engineering services.

The ideal candidate will have knowledge and understanding of ENTERPRISE class solutions from leading providers of on-premise and cloud networking/security solutions. Successful candidates will have a solid grasp of network and security design principles based on industry best practices.

**Travel Requirements:**

In this role you will be expected to travel up to 25%. You can be based in either the Grand Rapids, MI or Lansing, MI areas.

**Job Responsibilities:**

Develop high-level technical solutions and present to customers (Hardware, Software, Licensing, Professional Services).

Collect business and technical requirements.

Complete end-to-end, full lifecycle security/network designs.

Drive whiteboard conversations.

Craft customer facing presentations.

Delivering technical presentations and product demonstrations.

Generate hardware configurations (BoM).

Write statements of work (SoW) and develop Professional Service pricing utilizing Presidio tools.

Ability to self-pace and self-set direction in a team environment to drive business.

Work with Account Executive/Extended Sales Teams to develop customer relationship and solutions and assist in overall sales process.

Maintain and develop technical and technology specific skill sets and certifications.

**Required Skills:** 

Expert-level knowledge and experience with design, implementation, and support of two or more of the following:

Complex routing and switching solutions (Cisco, Juniper, Arista, Aruba)

Complex wireless solutions (Cisco, Juniper, Aruba)

SDN solutions (Cisco SD-Access, Cisco ACI, VMware NSX, CloudVision)

SDWAN solutions from Cisco, VMware, Palo Alto, Fortinet, Silver Peak, etc.

Cloud security and networking (AWS, Azure, GCP)

Firewalls/VPNs (Cisco, Palo Alto, Fortinet)

Network Access Control (ISE, FortiNAC, Aruba ClearPass)

IDS/IPS solutions (Cisco, Palo Alto, Fortinet)

MDR Solutions (Presidio, Arctic Wolf, Rapid7)

Endpoint security (CrowdStrike, SentinelOne, Carbon Black)

Identity and Access Management solutions

Micro-segmentation solutions (Guardicore, Illumio, Cisco Secure Workload)

SASE/SSE (Zscaler, Netskope, Palo Alto)

Security and compliance frameworks such as NIST, PCI, and HIPAA

Load balancing solutions (F5, Netscaler)

Cybersecurity offerings such as vulnerability assessments, penetration tests, compliance, segmentation strategy, or Red Team/Purple Team.

**Additional Desired Skills:**

Technical certifications in the areas of Enterprise Networking, Security, and/or Cloud

Experience with office productivity software and diagramming software such as MS Visio or Lucidchart

Experience in a Value-Added Reseller (VAR) environment

**Education and Experience:** 

Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience and/or military experience

3+ years of experience, which demonstrates a significant level of expertise in Enterprise Networking and/or Security solutions.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: Up to $150,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Health insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus opportunities

Experience:

* Solutions Architecture: 3 years (Required)
* Enterprise Networking: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Sales Engineer (North America)
description:

**About the company**

* Maxxess is a leading technology software and manufacturing firm providing enterprise security and system integration solutions worldwide. Maxxess brings new thinking to the electronic security industry through innovative, flexible, and extensible network-based software and mobile workforce management systems.

www.Maxxess-Systems.com

Maxxess specializes in a wide range of enterprise-level solutions:

* Operations Management

Maxxess's main headquarters are in Brea, California with offices and operations in the U.K., Europe, Middle East, Latin America, and Africa.

**Sales Engineer Responsibilities:**

**Job Description**

The Sales Engineer for Maxxess Systems (US) is focused on supporting key accounts, channel partners, and technology partners. The Sales Engineer will work to build ongoing technical relationships with our channel partners and customers as their best advocate for Maxxess solutions in the future. Your contributions and key position ensure that the solutions we provide keep our customers at their best in the moments that matter.
