title: Solutions Engineer
description:
**About Ceribell**



Ceribell produces the world's first brain monitor for point-of-care seizure triage and treatment. Our groundbreaking technology enables healthcare providers to test for a suspected seizure and then deliver treatments within minutes.  

We are a rapidly growing venture capital-backed medical technology startup. Ceribell is being used in hundreds of community hospitals, large academic facilities and major IDN's across the country. With extensive clinical validation of the effectiveness of our product and significant growth potential, all while we are pre-IPO, Ceribell is a fantastic career opportunity.

**POSITION OVERVIEW**



The Solutions Engineer is responsible for the pre and post sales and everything in between being a technical representative and a customer advocate within Ceribell. An ideal Solutions Engineer would have a genuine curiosity for technology and can simplify, explain, and present complex technical concepts.

  


**WHAT YOU'LL DO**


* Be a technical resource for internal territory managers as well as the customer to interface with. This may require creating solutions that help overcome technical, procedural, and political obstacles issues that arise.
* Assist in workflow discussions with the understanding of EMR orders, integration, and changes that may be necessary to bring Ceribell into the existing workflows.
* Work with hospital counterparts with vendor intake processes such as new vendor forms, security review/risk assessments, testing, and implementation of Ceribell EEG into the hospital environment.
* Troubleshooting customer issues and finding sustainable solutions.
* Demonstrate the ability to work independently with little guidance.
* Ultimately work in a fast-paced startup environment and be ready to make a difference.


**WHAT YOU'LL NEED:**


* Bachelor's Degree or similar work experience.
* 5+ years of work experience with a degree or 10+ years of experience without
* Ability to articulate and have a solid understanding of "how the internet works" including the ability to troubleshoot networks, firewalls, security, websites, database, API, etc. in a hospital or enterprise environment.
* Positive and professional and ready to be thrown into situations with customers or cross-functional teams to assess, develop, and prioritize solutions.
* Maintain technical skills and knowledge, keeping up with current technical trends, and being able to create Proof-of-Concept when needed.
* Knowledge in HIPAA, FDA, SOC2, HITRUST, FedRAMP, or similar regulations or requirements.

  


**OTHER PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**:


* Experience in a customer-facing and sales-aligned role and demonstrate versatility.
* Understanding of Cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, etc.) and software development.


**SPECIAL WORKING CONDITIONS**:


* Sometimes require working evenings and weekends with little advance notice to get the job done.
* Working with multiple time-zones across the US.
* Travel to customers locations within the US (up to 10%)


***This job description is not all inclusive. Incumbents may be required to complete other miscellaneous responsibilities as required.***


*Application Deadline: Ongoing*



#LI-GB1



#LI-Remote

 **In addition to your base compensation, Ceribell offers the following:**


* Annual Bonus Opportunity + Ceribell Equity
* 100% Employer paid Health Benefits for the Employee
* 50% - 70% Employer paid Health, Dental & Vision for dependents (according to plan selection)
* Life & Long-term disability insurance paid 100% by Ceribell
* Monthly cell phone stipend
* Flexible paid time off
* 11 Paid Holidays
* Excellent parental leave policy
* Fantastic culture with tremendous career advancement opportunities
* Joining a mission-minded organization!


**Compensation Range**


$110,000—$120,000 USD

title: Sales Engineer, Salesforce
description:
**Role:** Sales Engineer


***\\*\\*\\*Hands on Salesforce platform experience and/or certification required for this role\\*\\*\\****


**Description:** As a Sales Engineer, you will be a resource for Australia and PST based Account Executives to assist in increasing velocity and successfully closing Blackthorn deals. This is an individual contributor role that should be ready to roll up their sleeves.


**Base Salary:** $130,000USD +


**What you'll do**


* Conduct daily learning calls for Account Executives to ask questions
* Create and share common Salesforce solutions for gaps in the Blackthorn product
* Be a technical/product expert resource on sales calls with prospects
* Create examples of prospects and customer use cases in the shared demo org.
* Work internally with security resources to complete documents in a timely manner
* Conduct and execute demos by effectively navigating prospects through our product
* Compile all that is needed to produce a clean and polished final RFP, RFI, RFQ proposal
* Create success plans prior to closed won deals for a smooth transition to Customer Success and Onboarding teams


**What we look for**


* 2+ years of working for a B2B SaaS company
* 2+ years of consulting in a Salesforce ecosystem
* 2+ years of Sales Engineer experience (working with AEs on demos)
* Salesforce certified admin
* Has previously configured and demoed Salesforce product to end-users
* Has previously owned the completion of RFP's (requirement docs, security docs, proposals)

 **What we offer**


* An incredible team of smart and supportive people
* A deep feeling of satisfaction and completion
* Fully remote global team working from home
* Stock options to every employee (We are ALL owners)
* Four day work week (Actually a thing)
* $400 office stipend
* Maternity/Paternity leave
* Student loan debt assistance
* Pledge 1% - time off during the year for helping nonprofits
* Health insurance contribution (if in the US)
* Children's 529 college fund assistance (if in the US)


**About Blackthorn**



We have five native apps on the Salesforce AppExchange for managing Events, collecting Payments, sending Messages, protecting Data, and showcasing a virtual Storefront. We're a growing, distributed team in four countries. We move fast and have significant structure in our product build process. Everyone on our team has deep experience within their respective roles. Our customers span from 1 person companies to Fortune 500s.


**Why is our work important**



Our apps continue to be easy to use and setup, due to continuous refinements with our UX. Most apps in our space take weeks to implement, ours take hours, and they work more flexibly, achieving significantly more functionality than our competitors. We believe enterprise apps should be as easy to use as consumer mobile apps.


**What the job will bring you**



A deep level of satisfaction through ownership of your role. You'll get more autonomy than at other companies (we've been told by our team). Connection. Our team is tightly knit, assisted through our annual company trip (as we're remote). Challenge. We're trying to move as quick as possible. This is not for you if you want to sit back and chill. As Ray Dalio says about life: "Meaningful work and meaningful relationships" provide meaning to life. We aim to bring this.

title: Data Scientist - Sales Engineer
description:
**Who we are**



“Our supply chain lacks visibility!”



– Every Pharmaceutical supply chain, transportation and quality executive.



Although that’s not quite accurate. In fact, most companies already have an abundance of IoT and passive logger data. What they don’t have is contextual and operational data that enables - action.



PAXAFE bridges the trust gap between manufacturers, shippers and service providers by contextualizing data into meaningful information. We believe that the intersection between supply chain, technology and insurance is ripe for innovation, and **we believe that we can become the most accurate arbiter of quantifying, predicting and underwriting supply chain risk**.



Because the scariest notion in business: “we’ve always done it that way.”


**What we do**



PAXAFE provides an autonomous AI-enabled decision support system for supply chain leaders to exhibit resiliency and automation from their visibility investments.



PAXAFE’s SaaS platform — CONTXT — is a device-agnostic risk-management platform (powered by ATHENA LLM) that automates lane mapping and temperature management workflow, minimizes product and lane qualification lead times and reduces overall product loss for Life Science shippers and service providers.



PAXAFE contextualizes active and passive visibility data, quantifies risk and predicts OTIF adverse events.


**Job Overview**



As a Data Science Sales Engineer with PAXAFE, you will work directly with enterprise sales teams as a data science subject matter expert to optimize configuration and maximize customer value behind PAXAFE’s supply chain risk platform. The ideal candidate will be the 'voice' of our data team, adept at translating complex customer requirements into compelling and simple solutions for our customers. This role is pivotal in ensuring customer delight by addressing their needs in collaboration with our Customer Success team. You will help prospective customers and partners understand the power of our platform, explaining technical features, helping customers design architectures, and problem-solving through potential roadblocks. In this role, you will work closely with customers, Product, Customer Success and Growth teams to optimize for usage and value of CONTXT intelligence platform.**Responsibilities**


* Work with the team to identify and qualify business opportunities, understand key customer technical objections, and develop the strategy to resolve technical blockers
* Provide in-depth data science expertise to support the technical relationship with customers, including product and solution briefings and proof-of-concept work. Partner directly with product management to prioritize solutions impacting customer adoption to PAXAFE’s platform
* Translate complex data findings into understandable, actionable insights for customers. Create presentations and reports that clearly communicate these insights
* Engage directly with customers to understand their data needs and challenges, ensuring a seamless customer experience
* Work closely with the customer success team to align data solutions with customer goals and objectives. Act as a bridge between the data and customer success teams
* Work on onboarding customer shipping lanes onto PAXAFE’s various intelligence products
* Gather customer feedback on data products and services, and work with the data team to implement improvements
* Travel to customer sites, conferences, and other related events


**Requirements**


* 3+ years in data science, machine learning, or related field
* Proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools (e.g., Python, SQL, Superset).
* Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex data to non-technical audiences.
* Strong understanding of customer needs and the ability to empathize with customer perspectives.
* Be comfortable talking about technical concepts, and explaining how PAXAFE works, both from a product feature and Data science perspective


* Bonus: Prior experience from a fast-growing startup, Big Tech or Supply Chain Visibility / Risk Management software


**Culture at PAXAFE**



We're an ambitious, growing, smart, and open-minded group. Our employees are passionate about our mission and eager to complete their work at the highest level. People first, people.



Fun stuff we do:


* Team on-sites
* Team off-sites
* Hackathons
* Silicon Valley Thursdays
* Monthly Game Fridays
* & so much more!

  


**Perks up**



PAXAFE offers:


* Competitive salary and performance-based bonus


* ESOP stock options


* 401(K) Match


* Comprehensive healthcare: Health | Dental | Vision 100% covered for Individual; 65% for Dependents


* Leadership & Development opportunities, courses and credits


* 5 Weeks PTO


* Remote-first culture where you can work from anywhere with a stable internet connection (Must be available to travel 2-3 times annually to on-site / off-site)


* Access to top tier venture capitalists, mentors, advisors and industry leaders through PAXAFE’s investor and advisor network


* 1 offsite retreat annually for team members located in North America


**Core Values**



In order to ‘build what can’t be built,’ we must bring on people who can ‘do what can’t be done.’



Every single person that we hire exhibits these values and characteristics:


* **C**reate magic


* **O**wn With Pride


* **N**avigate With Intent


* **T**hink Deep, Act Fast


* **X**-hibit Teamwork


* **T**ackle With Empathy


**PAXAFE is the world**



PAXAFE stands for a culture of inclusion – just ask our Co-Founders, who each hail from India and Russia! We celebrate different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives —encouraging everyone to bring their authentic selves to work. We have a diverse environment that empowers our team to feel comfortable when they voice their opinions. For these reasons and more, PAXAFE is a proud equal employment opportunity employer. We welcome everyone regardless of their race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or genetics, and we are dedicated to providing an inclusive, open, and diverse work environment.

title: Sales Engineer Consumables SST
description:
Single Source Technologies, representing Makino as well as other high end machine tool products, is a single-source provider of machine tools, engineering services, tooling, supplies, application support and customer service throughout North America.
  

**The Opportunity**  

The Sales Engineer Consumables SST is responsible for the development of profitable sales of Makino EDM Consumables and the lead generation of EDM Makino machine opportunities within assigned territory through contacts, inquiries, services, advertising and correspondence. This involves continuous development of current and potential users of company line of machine tool products, consumables and accessories.  

  

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**
* Develop strong relationships with customers as the “first line” of Sales
* Initiate sales calls and create rapport with Makino Sales Engineers to develop Consumable and Machine Sales relationships.
* Organize work and planning activities for the most effective coverage of assigned territory.
* Schedule calls on actual and prospective customers.
* Identify Makino machine lead opportunities by understanding customer needs and their operations.
* Provide detailed description of sales opportunities to Manager and enter information into CRM software.
* Contact customer and prospective customers to discuss requirements, specifications, problems and/or any outstanding issues.
* Prepare and generate sales quotes with assistance from Consumable Support Associates.
* Track past-due shipments and keep customers informed of any changes or situations affecting delivery.
* Constantly review consumable sales efforts and results in relation to forecasts or potential of territory.
* Provide input into the consumable forecast process to support procurement of required materials to the Consumables Operations Group.
* Interact professionally with customers and employees at all levels of the organization.

**Required Skills**
* Valid driver’s license and ability to drive to customer locations to establish rapport, as well as deliver product in person.
* Technical knowledge of EDM Consumable products with ability to share with customers in a professional and persuasive manner.
* Proficient computer skills, including knowledge of MS Office (experience with SalesLogix and SAP preferred).
* Strong ambition and eagerness to develop new sales strategies, territories and customers required.
* Team player with ability to work closely with Makino Machines Sales Engineers and the Consumable Operations Groups and work in tandem to promote a team environment.
* Solid problem-solving skills and decision-making skills.
* Excellent communication and customer relation skills.
* Willingness to travel weekly.

**Education and Required Experience**
* Bachelor’s degree in related field and/or relevant EDM Consumable sales experience.
* Previous experience with EDM machine tools or EDM Consumables (preferred).
* Previous experience developing sales territory and the ability to “close” the sale.

We believe that the interests of our company and people are inseparable, and we are committed to developing a diverse team of creative and independent professionals. Employees enjoy a stable work environment from a company with years of success and growth in the machine tool industry.

  

Makino offers competitive pay, generous benefits and ongoing training.
M**akino is proud to be an EEO/M/F/Disabled/Vets employer.**

title: Sales Engineer (Telecommunications & Networking)
description:
Velocity is seeking to hire a Sales Engineer. A Sales Engineer is a key contributor in our dynamic and rapidly growing solutions team. Leveraging expertise in telecommunications, networking, and wireless you will play a vital role in driving business growth through technical consultation, solution design, and exceptional customer support. Working closely with our sales team to understand customer needs, you will design customized solutions that address those customer challenges and contribute to the development of technical proposals.
**Primary Duties and Responsibilities**:
* Collaborate with the sales team(s) to understand customer needs and provide technical solutions that align with our product and service offerings.
* Stay up to date on the latest developments in telecommunications, networking, wireless, low-voltage cabling, fiber optics, and equipment from multiple vendors.
* Maintain a deep understanding of Velocity’s product and service portfolio.
* Conduct product presentations, demonstrations, and technical discussions with clients to showcase the value of our solutions. Tailor presentations to address specific customer requirements.
* Work closely with our Engineering team to analyze site survey results and design solutions based upon those results.
* Prepare professional technical diagrams for presentation and deployment purposes.
* Work closely with customers to design customized solutions that meet their unique business challenges, incorporating a range of technologies and products.
* Assist in the preparation of technical proposals, including scope of work, technical specifications, and pricing. Ensure that proposals align with customer requirements and industry best practices.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with key vendors and manufacturers. Stay informed about new products and technologies in the market.
* Provide pre-sales and post-sales technical support to the sales team(s) and customers. Address technical inquiries, conduct product training sessions, and resolve technical issues.

**Qualifications, Experience and Education:**
* Minimum Requirements
	+ Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering, telecommunications, a related field or equivalent work experience.
	+ Proven experience in sales engineering, with a focus on telecommunications, networking, wireless, low-voltage cabling, fiber optics, and equipment from multiple vendors.
	+ Strong technical knowledge of industry standards and best practices.
	+ Excellent communication and presentation skills.
	+ Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.
	+ Proven ability to understand and translate customer requirements into technical solutions.

**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:**
* In-depth understanding of telecommunications and networking technologies, protocols, and architectures.
* Familiarity with wireless communication technologies and their applications, including Wi-Fi, cellular networks, and IoT.
* Knowledge of low voltage cabling systems, including installation, termination, and testing procedures.
* Broad knowledge of equipment and solutions offered by various vendors in the industry, staying current with their product portfolios.
* Ability to create comprehensive technical proposals, including scope of work, technical specifications, and pricing.
* Ability to understand customer needs and provide technical solutions that align with both customer requirements and company offerings.
* Proficient in designing customized solutions that address specific customer challenges using a combination of technologies and products.
* Strong presentation skills, including the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
* Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams, including sales, engineering, and customer support.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities to address technical challenges and provide effective solutions.
* Ability to adapt to evolving technologies and industry trends, ensuring a proactive approach to staying current in a dynamic environment.
* Dedication to understanding and meeting customer needs, with a commitment to delivering high levels of customer satisfaction.
* Effective time management skills to handle multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, meeting deadlines and priorities.
* Understanding of sales processes and the ability to align technical solutions with business goals to drive sales.


**Why you’ll love working at Velocity**
We are an energetic bunch — eager to succeed and have lots of company pride. We promote a collaborative work environment that prioritizes strengthening relationships with our customers and team members to achieve our goals.
As a growing technology solutions and services company, every team member at Velocity has the opportunity to make an impact as we challenge ourselves to provide the best technology and customer experiences in the business. We’re excited about what we do, why we do it, and who we do it for.
**Diversity and Inclusion**
Velocity is committed to diversity and inclusion and is dedicated to fostering a work environment where all team members are comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work and have equal opportunities to thrive. Our team members work collaboratively and draw inspiration from various perspectives and experiences that make each of us unique. This strengthens our connections with our team members, customers, and communities.
**Our Values – Collaborative and Strong at the Core**
* Customer-obsessed
* One team
* Do the right thing
* Let’s go!


**Our Benefits**
* Medical, Dental, Vision
* PTO & Paid Holidays
* 401K – with Employer Match
* Paid Parental Leave
* Company provided Life Insurance, Short/Long-Term Disability
* Supplemental Benefits Available


**About Velocity MSC**
Velocity started in 2005. Velocity's customer-obsessed approach, combined with its customized voice and data network solutions, and support services, enhances how multi-location enterprises communicate and do business. That’s why Velocity serves thousands of Fortune 500 companies across various industries. With over 500 employees, 13 redundant data centers, 450 carrier agreements, and 5,500 certified technicians throughout the U.S.— Velocity is an unstoppable force. To learn more, please visit https://velocitymsc.com/careers/.
Velocity is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information. Velocity is an active participant with E-Verify.

title: Sales Engineer
description:
#### **Description**



Molecule Software is a dynamic and fast-growing innovator in the commodities trading (CTRM/ETRM) software industry. Our enterprise SaaS product is a market leader in technology, usability, integrations and more.



Our employees are distributed across the United States and work remotely. The official head office is in Houston.



We are looking to add a Sales Engineer to our Sales team. This role will be the first Sales Engineer at Molecule. You will own 100% of the technical side of new deals. For the right person this is a great opportunity to shape how Molecule responds to technical challenges from the sales perspective. Our ideal candidate is one that has technical experience in the commodity trading space, has participated in customer facing demonstrations of software solutions, and can identify and offer solutions to potential customers experiencing challenges with their current systems.


#### **Responsibilities**


* Deeply understand the Molecule software, its capabilities, and how to effectively set it up for various business and commodity types
* Prepare and present custom demonstrations.
* Provide support including technical sales calls, training, presentations, proof-of-concepts, capacity planning and technical ROI models.
* Represent Molecule at trade shows and other speaking engagements as needed.
* Maintain Molecule's demo environment for demonstrations on sales calls and tradeshow events.
* Build scripts and reports in Python and SQL to handle custom scenarios and outputs.
* Capture and prioritize issues and feature requests to enter our Engineering pipeline.
* Identify internal processes that need improvement and participate in upgrading them.
* Participate in discovery calls.
* Respond to RFPs.
* Ability to perform in from of an audience

#### **Requirements**



Must Have:


* CRM experience and the ability to keep yours up to date
* Experience using Python and SQL to build scripts and reports to handle custom scenarios and outputs
* A strong passion for disruptive technology
* Familiarity with Finance concepts and calculations, as they relate to commodity trading
* Ability to prioritize and triage, given many urgent and important tasks
* Proactive, get things done approach and ability to solve issues and move things forward
* Strong written and verbal communication skills, and customer orientation
* Schedule flexibility – may need to align to earlier or later North American time zones


Nice to Have:


* Financial Background
* A Bachelor's degree or better
* CTRM/ETRM experience

#### **Benefits**



Molecule has an awesome benefits package—one that fits right in with the small company that we are. Benefits include:


* Full medical, dental, and vision insurance (100% company-paid)
* Life and AD&D (100% company-paid)
* No limit on paid vacation days (within reason; with approval)
* Sick time, as-you-need-it

#### **Salary Range**



The salary range for this role is $110,000.00 to $150,000.00 depending on experience.

title: Solution Sales Engineer
description:
**About OneFitStop**
--------------------


**OneFitStop empowers premier fitness facilities to build efficient and powerful business operations through superior technology and remarkable experiences.**


The **OneFitStop** **FitStack** Solution is a turnkey solution for fitness facilities powering boutique and big-box (gym) operations globally. The OneFitStop technology services the day-to-day operations of a fitness business: Membership Management, Access Control, Class Scheduling, Member Mobile and Web Experiences, Point of Sale, Corporate Reporting and more.

  

  

**About the Solution Sales Engineer position**
----------------------------------------------


We are looking for a seasoned, hardworking, **technical** and over achieving Solution Sales Engineer with proven experience and a passion for selling technology solutions to senior executives. This role requires an appreciation of establishing trust through a rigorous discovery of the business opportunities for technology enabled business value released through the OneFitStop platform


You will be responsible for supporting the sales executives in both new prospects as well as farming back into existing customers to ensure high renewal and customer satisfaction levels. Measures of success include new customer acquisition rates, renewal rates, up-selling, cross-selling, customer satisfaction and contribution to overall sales team and business success.

  

  

**Solution Sales Engineer responsibilities are:**
-------------------------------------------------


* Supporting sales executives with solution selling into prospect account
* Partnering with sales executives to execute strategic deals
* Collecting competitive intelligence
* Creating superb presentations and demos that both clearly address the critical customer requirements and communicate the uniqueness of the OneFitStop value proposition
* Managing all technical aspects of RFP / RFI responses
* Effectively communicating client needs to the R&D teams

  

**Sales Engineer requirements are:**
------------------------------------


* Experience as a Software Sales Engineer
* Being familiar with SaaS platforms associated with this line of work
* Excellent creativity and presentation skills
* Being able to forge long-lasting relationships with executives
* Superb communication skills
* Record of selling complex enterprise solutions
* BA/BSc or Asc degree in Marketing, Business or related field with numeracy base

title: Pre-Sales Engineer
description:
Location: remote  

  

A dedicated, knowledgeable communicator who can guide our clients through complex infrastructural decisions pre and post sale, and maintain those relationships through detailed technical advice and superb personal skills.  

  

What will you be doing?  

* Elaboration of possible technical solutions based on the customer's business requirements
* Preparing and performing technical presentations as well as analysis of customer technical requirements
* Being the single point of contact for the customer's technical inquiries
* Creating a strong, trusting relationship with the customers technical and IT organizations
* Providing technical support for distributors, partners and end customers
* Advising sales managers on technical issues
* Developing and preparing specifications for different vertical market projects
* Presenting at conferences and seminars
* Creating articles for technical issues
* Creating technical solutions and running technical presentations for customers and company employees
* Helping in creation of full packet docs for tender.

  

Job Experience/Requirements:  

* At least 2 years experience in a similar position
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Experience delivering solutions to a Telco
* 3-5 years working at a Telco
* Demonstrated knowledge of one or more Communications Service Provider markets
* Technical university degree, experience in telecom
* Experience with business benefits and value proposition
* Experience in developing technical requirements, solution architecture, structure and volume of work, project schedule
* Expert knowledge of standards and solutions for SDN / NFV
* Expert knowledge of business processes and functions of Telco operator: planning, development, operations, fulfillment, assurance, etc.
* Knowledge of technologies of mobile and fixed networks
* Willingness to travel
* Fluent English
* Attention to detail, plus analytical and problem-solving capabilities
* Ability to work under pressure and make quickdecisions

  

Successful candidate is assured of a competitive compensation**/**benefits package.

title: Rf Engineer
description:
Summary:
Primarily provides pre-sales technical support for the development and implementation of complex products/applications/solutions. Uses in-depth product knowledge to provide technical expertise to sales staff and the customer through sales presentations and product demonstrations. Assists the sales staff in assessing potential application of company products to meet customer needs and may prepare detailed product specifications for the development and implementation of customer products/applications/solutions. May create detailed design and implementation specifications for complex products/applications/solutions. May build a mini-application based on customer requirements to demonstrate feasibility of the application, often requiring rapid prototyping and/or product demo for client. May provide consultation to prospective users and/or product capability assessment and validation.
Duties & Responsibilities:
Solutions engineers in VIAVI are expected to be subject matter experts in specified fields and technologies, working in a sales environment to support VIAVI products and business plans. We are looking for professionals with knowledge and experience in radio frequency (RF) communications (e.g., 4G/5G cellular test, non-cellular communications systems such as land-mobile radio). The responsibilities include:* Listening to understanding concerns and challenges of RF communications customers - including cellular service providers, network equipment manufacturers/integrators, government organizations and enterprises – issues faced with network quality, performance test, maintenance or ramp test, design validation, etc.
* Engage in detailed technical and applications discussions with customers to appropriately position solutions from VIAVI to help customers achieve their results.
* Work closely with sales teams and sales partners to drive product sales for the selected technologies or application areas.
* Contribute to business growth - identify and seed potential new opportunities, lead or be in a cross-functional team to identify growth opportunities and execute on growth plans. Support marketing programs to build awareness and advantages of VIAVI products and solutions.
* Work with product units collaboratively to provide feedback on customer application/feature needs, product gaps and/or improvements to improve VIAVI competitive position in the market, provide market and competitive feedback and work with business units to get what is needed to win.


We are currently looking for a suitable candidate to support our operations in India. The preferred work location is Mumbai or Gurugram, but we can be flexible on office location for the right candidate. Wherever the location, the job will require travel within India and occasionally beyond.
If your experience and knowledge include some of these, then we’re looking for you:* Broad understanding of RF and radio communications technologies, as applied in secure/mission-critical communications or cellular applications.
	+ Land mobile radio or critical communications (“LMR” or “PMR”), such as analog radios, P25, DMR, TETRA.
	+ Understanding 5G/4G cellular – network architecture, typical RF network issues faced by cellular service providers in 4G/5G RAN, with specific knowledge of RF parameters.
* RF testing in design, manufacturing, or field test. Familiarity with common test instruments/systems such as radio communications testers (VIAVI or equivalent), spectrum/signal analyzers, either as a user, in a service provision role or in test solutions provider.
* 5-7 years of experience in the fields and environments described above. We are open to making exceptions for outstanding candidates showing strong willingness to learn, or with a proven track record of performance.
	+ Experience with test systems, test system automation including instrument programming (e.g. Python) will be given additional preference
* Strong communications - ability to listen, present technological and product information, articulate complex ideas. Communicate value propositions. Good written and speaking style.
* Demonstrable track-record of success in a sales environment – target oriented, good management of time and priorities, working with cross functional groups.
* Can work autonomously and work with a team. Self-learner.
* Experience with customer interactions in pre-sales, projects, documenting compliances or putting together value propositions.
* Willing to travel domestically and internationally. Travel in normal times may be up to 40% of work days.


Pre-Requisites / Skills / Experience Requirements:

Pre-Requisites / Skills / Experience Requirements:

title: Technical Consultant
description:
**What You'll Do**


Cisco Umbrella is looking for a Customer Support Engineer (Tier I) to join our Support Team.


At Cisco Umbrella, Customer Support is marketing. Helping our customers is the best way to give to our brand and you're our ambassador in this mission. This is an opportunity to join a fast-growing distributed team where you will be able to offer outstanding technical expertise for Cisco Umbrella, which is used and loved by tens of millions around the world. You will also have an opportunity to support our Secure Internet Gateway (SIG) product as well. You will act as the customer’s guide in ensuring that Cisco Cloud Security provides them with the best possible experience.

  

**Role & Responsibilities**


* Respond to customer support requests via phone and email
* Diagnose and provide solutions to technical issues
* Research issues while maintaining communication with end-users
* Raise issues to Tier II and Tier III support, as needed
* Build end user documentation and recommend procedure changes to improve efficiency
* Multitask efficiently, toggling from email support to incoming calls throughout your shift
* Maintain composure in a fast-paced professional environment
* Solving problems accurately, creatively, and efficiently
* Work well in a distributed team environment
* Multi-functional collaboration
* Able to work weekends on a rotational schedule
  
**Who You'll Work With**


The Cloud Security support team delivers outstanding technical consulting and support to a substantial portion of Cisco’s customer base. Our vision is to drive customer loyalty through compelling support experience and our team does this every single day by solving sophisticated, confusing, and often groundbreaking network security problems. Do you want to innovate with us and make a difference in the constant fight for secure networking?

  

**Who You Are**


**Minimum Qualifications**


* You have achieved a bachelor's degree, or have accrued relevant past work experience, in a technical field (CS/CE/EE preferred) and have 2+ years of customer facing experience in network/IT support.
* Have a real passion for supporting network security products.
* Experienced at solving sophisticated networking issues and have a superb grasp of fundamental networking.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills, and you are skilled in answering customers’ technical inquiries.
* Desire to expand your skills, move into new areas.
* Diligent and analytical.
* Comfortable problem solving via both phone and email.
* Hold a CCNA (R&S or Security) certification or have equivalent work experience.
  
**Desired Skills**


* Familiarity solving and understanding LAN/WAN environments, Active Directory, DNS, multiple OS platforms, cloud-based security products
* Experience in high level Wireshark analysis
* Web Proxy support experience
* Familiarity with Firewall, ISR or VPN
* Familiarity with Zendesk, JIRA
* Ability to prioritize and work responsibly with or without direct supervision.
  
**You should apply if you…**


* Care about giving to an amazing work culture and environment
* Are comfortable navigating a fast-paced role
* Are comfortable asking questions and reading documentation daily
* Are passionate about helping customers
* Have impeccable communication - both verbal and written
* Can work weekends on a rotational basis
  
**Important things to note**


* This is a role where change is constant
* We are a team that pushes each other and learns together
* This is a customer facing frontline support role
* Working some weekends is required
* Assisting customers via phone is required
* You must be comfortable asking for help
  
**Why Cisco**


At Cisco, each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference. Yes, our technology changes the way the world works, lives, plays and learns, but our edge comes from our people.


We connect everything – people, process, data, and things – and we use those connections to change our world for the better.


We innovate everywhere, taking bold risks to shape the technologies that give us smart cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with unique personalities who aren’t afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns. We are thought leaders, tech geeks, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers.


#WeAreCisco


  
**Message to applicants applying to work in the U.S. and/or Canada:**  

  

When available, the salary range posted for this position reflects the projected hiring range for new hire, full-time salaries in U.S. and/or Canada locations, not including equity or benefits. For non-sales roles the hiring ranges reflect base salary only; employees are also eligible to receive annual bonuses. Hiring ranges for sales positions include base and incentive compensation target. Individual pay is determined by the candidate's hiring location and additional factors, including but not limited to skillset, experience, and relevant education, certifications, or training. Applicants may not be eligible for the full salary range based on their U.S. or Canada hiring location. The recruiter can share more details about compensation for the role in your location during the hiring process.
U.S. employees have **access** to quality medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with a Cisco matching contribution, short and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance and numerous wellbeing offerings. Employees receive up to twelve paid holidays per calendar year, which includes one floating holiday, plus a day off for their birthday. Employees accrue up to 20 days of Paid Time Off (PTO) each year and have access to paid time away to deal with critical or emergency issues without tapping into their PTO. We offer additional paid time to volunteer and give back to the community. Employees are also able to purchase company stock through our Employee Stock Purchase Program.


Employees on sales plans earn performance-based incentive pay on top of their base salary, which is split between quota and non-quota components. For quota-based incentive pay, Cisco typically pays as follows:


.75% of incentive target for each 1% of revenue attainment up to 50% of quota;


1.5% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 50% and 75%;


1% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 75% and 100%; and once performance exceeds 100% attainment, incentive rates are at or above 1% for each 1% of attainment with no cap on incentive compensation.


For non-quota-based sales performance elements such as strategic sales objectives, Cisco may pay up to 125% of target. Cisco sales plans do not have a minimum threshold of performance for sales incentive compensation to be paid.

title: Application Developer
description:
Sales Application Engineer (India market)

**BANGALORE, INDIA**

**SALES & BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT**

**REMOTE**

**FULL-TIME**


Are you keen on providing customer support for technical products? Do you like working in a 3D CAD-like environment? Does finding solutions for difficult engineering problems challenge you? Are you able to think along with customers on a technical level? Then YOU are just the person we are looking for!  

What you will do* Be the technical expert in using our software solutions
* Act as the bridge between the customer, account manager, and software development team
* Guide our customers by providing training and support and demonstrating the technical capabilities of the software
* Have a pre-sales role in uncovering in-depth requirements by consulting with customers as part of the sales process to link them to the best solution
* Provide technical support and expertise for a variety of additive manufacturing software applications in support of customers’ research and development
* Assist with technical expertise at trade shows, events, conferences, etc.
Your profile* Bachelor's/master’s degree in mechanical or mechatronics engineering with at least 3 years of relevant working experience in a Sales & Application Engineer related role
* A natural interest and passion for 3D printing and innovative technologies.
* Knowledge/experience/qualification in 3D CAD (computer-aided design) software
* Familiarity with computer-aided engineering principles like CAD and FEA is a plus
* Willingness to travel to visit customers and attend conferences
* You are well-organized, team-oriented, and have good communication skills in English
* You will be based in India
Location and type of contract* Bangalore, India
* Full-time
* Hybrid
* Associate level

  
Working at Materialise


Materialise is a dynamic, international high-tech company, founded in 1990 and headquartered in Belgium, with over 2,300 employees worldwide. Materialise’s mission is to innovate for a better and healthier world through its software and hardware infrastructure and in-depth knowledge of additive manufacturing (also known as 3D printing). Our customers are in diverse industries, such as automotive, aerospace, medical, research, and academia.
  

  

As a growing company, Materialise is always looking for enthusiastic professionals who want to work in an environment full of revolutionary technology and surrounded by people passionate about their work.**More information**


What we offer

**Healthy life-work balance**
When creating a better and healthier world, a good place to start is with yourself. That's why we encourage our employees to prioritize their overall well-being, fostering physical fitness, mental resilience, and social connections through a range of workshops, sports activities, and other events and initiatives that contribute to a balanced and fulfilling work-life harmony.**Personal growth & career development****Team building****Innovation & leadership****Hybrid working & flexibility**

title: Senior Customer Support Representative
description:
About SiFive*As the pioneers who introduced RISC-V to the world, SiFive is transforming the future of compute by bringing the limitless potential of RISC-V to the highest performance and most data-intensive applications in the world. SiFive’s unrivaled compute platforms are continuing to enable leading technology companies around the world to innovate, optimize and deliver the most advanced solutions of tomorrow across every market segment of chip design, including artificial intelligence, machine learning, automotive, data center, mobile, and consumer. With SiFive, the future of RISC-V has no limits.*
At SiFive, we are always excited to connect with talented individuals, who are just as passionate about driving innovation and changing the world as we are.
Our constant innovation and ongoing success is down to our amazing teams of incredibly talented people, who collaborate and support each other to come up with truly groundbreaking ideas and solutions. Solutions that will have a huge impact on people's lives; making the world a better place, one processor at a time.
Are you ready?
To learn more about SiFive’s phenomenal success and to see why we have won the GSA’s prestigious Most Respected Private Company Award (for the fourth time!), check out our website and Glassdoor pages.
Job Description:  

Responsibilities:* Debug and resolve physical design issues of SiFive RISC-V CPU IP’s for pre- and post-sales customers
* Improve and enhance the customer experience of physical design implementation using foundation flows of major EDA vendors
* Generate high quality PPA (Power, Performance and Area) collaterals for broad portfolio of SiFive CPU IP and participate in PPA benchmarking for customer designs
* Work closely with the RM (Release Management) team to ensure the physical design quality of the different designs delivered to customers
* Automate the generation, data extraction/analysis and management of PPA collaterals
* Collaborate with physical design flow development teams to drive best-in-class automation and PPA


Requirements* 5+ years of physical implementation experience in a wide range of technologies; Experience with CPU implementation and advanced process nodes (7nm and below) is strongly preferred;
* Expertise in aggressive PPA optimization through physical design techniques
* Working experience on a customer-facing role is strongly preferred
* Understanding of logic design and CPU architecture is a strong plus
* Good working knowledge of scripting (Python or Perl) and automation is required
* Attention to detail and a focus on high-quality design
* Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering


Additional Information:
This position requires a successful background and reference checks and satisfactory proof of your right to work in:
India
Any offer of employment for this position is also contingent on the Company verifying that you are a authorized for access to export-controlled technology under applicable export control laws or, if you are not already authorized, our ability to successfully obtain any necessary export license(s) or other approvals.
SiFive is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

description:

Job ID: 58573

, Remote Work Allowed

In this position, you will work as part of the Construction team, supporting our sales, design, and customer service teams. You would be reporting to the Construction Engineering team line manager.

* Providing a high level of technical support in conjunction with the Customer service/Construction team.

title: Commissioning Engineer
description:
**Commissioning Engineer**
==========================

#### **Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future. At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.**

  

You will be working as Commissioning Engineer and will be part of Process Automation business for Process Industries division based in Jamshedpur, India. In this role you will be reporting to Engineering Manager and will be responsible for pre-commissioning protocols, commissioning protocols, commissioning check lists, safety checklists, load trial data, critical commissioning data, commissioning documents like no-load trial graphs, load trial graphs, parameter backup, software backup to be maintained precisely.

### **Your responsibilities**

* Preparing of commissioning progress status report on weekly basis along with working timesheet details
* Working towards generating sales opportunities while working at customer site
* Prepare and maintain pending job list & expedite project closure
* Updating reusable solutions, work-around and problems handled into database
* Following safety norms, ensuring safe working environment
* Traveling to site for long as well short-term projects, service calls, shutdown and breakdown calls

### **Your background**

* Bachelor’s degree or diploma from a reputed university with first class in electrical / electrical and electronics engineering
* 5 to 8 years of relevant work experience in drives solutions by similar suppliers
* Experience of commissioning/ trouble shooting / servicing drive systems preferably in metal industry and industrial cranes
* Knowledge of AC / DC drives (converters / inverters) and motors
* Knowledge of IT / Network / Peripherals like UPS, Printer, PC’s, Server components of DCS
* Knowledge in application programming and HMI development/ modifications for PLC/ DCS systems

### **More about us**


Process Industries division delivers complete electrification and automation solutions, industry-specific products and lifecycle services across industries. Engineering and delivering automation solutions from device to monitoring and control make our customers get more out of their investment; digitalization solutions including collaborative operations and augmented reality help improve plant and enterprise productivity, reduce maintenance and energy costs. Our engineering, project management, services and solutions portfolio covers a wide range of industries - Mining, Pulp & Paper, Metals, Aluminum and Cement, Data centers and Food and Beverage We look forward to receiving your application (documents submitted in English are appreciated). If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com. It has come to our attention that the name of ABB is being used for asking candidates to make payments for job opportunities (interviews, offers). Please be advised that ABB makes no such requests. All our open positions are made available on our career portal for all fitting the criteria to apply. ABB does not charge any fee whatsoever for recruitment process. Please do not make payments to any individuals / entities in connection to recruitment with ABB, even if is claimed that the money is refundable. ABB is not liable for such transactions. For current open positions you can visit our career website https://global.abb/group/en/careers and apply. Please refer to detailed recruitment fraud caution notice using the link https://global.abb/group/en/careers/how-to-apply/fraud-warning. Work model: on site #LI-onsite

title: Process Engineer
description:
Sandvik Manufacturing Solutions (SMF) is on an exciting growth journey, building the new digital era of manufacturing, and we have the know-how and innovative mindset to develop ideas into pioneering tech solutions. As a business area segment within Sandvik Group, SMF incorporates the three divisions of Design & Planning Automation, Additive Manufacturing and Industrial Metrology.
SigmaNEST one of the growing business units within SMF is the leading provider of innovative end-to-end CAD/CAM software solutions to help professional fabricators increase ROI by optimizing material utilization, machine motion, manpower, and data management. SigmaNEST is simply the best nesting software in the industry. With unmatched versatility and maximum scalability, the comprehensive product portfolio covers the full range of fabrication workflow; from quoting to shipping, including robust integration with a wide range of business systems.
The Role  

This person is responsible for developing new Post Processors and custom plugins, Editing old Post or plugins on AE’s request. Must have good communication skills to interact with global teams. Will be responsible to maintain post and plugin records, might need to travel onsite on request.
Job Title: Post Process Engineer (SigmaNEST)
Based at: Pune - Maharashtra – India
Work from office
Areas of responsibility:* Responsible for Post-development (Scripting of Post Processors) for all the machines posts for SigmaTEK India
* Responsible for Developing Plugins or Modifying developed plugins as per the requirement given by the customer
* Responsible for developing custom reports form software (Scripting part)
* Responsible for the delivering Posts/Plugins to the customer within the time frame allotted by the manager
* Might need to travel onsite if required but mostly shall be stationed at the office
* Develop new post processors to support CNC machines within our proprietary CAD/CAM software
* Build test cases, NC programs, and runoff parts for the post certification process for CNC machines
* Provide technical consultation to the software development, sales, and applications support departments regarding the capabilities, variations, and output requirements for the variety of supported CNC machines
* Modify and maintain existing customers post processors on an on-going basis
* Create accompanying post user documentation


Main Requirements:* Bachelor’s degree in computer science / mechanical / Industrial / Electrical Engineering, or related field
* 3 or more years of experience in Experience with programming in Delphi, C++, and C#
* Strong object-oriented programming skills is a must.
* Strong problem-solving skills
* English Communication
* Good communication and customer service skills
* Ability to work independently.
* Strong math skills
* Ability to travel up to 25% of the time.


A glimpse of our culture
At Sandvik, we're tech driven, innovative and entrepreneurial! For us, success is a team effort - we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive culture where people can be themselves and reach their full potential. So, we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our differences. We also give you the freedom to find that perfect mix between work, family life and interests. Visit our stories hub, LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us further.

title: Mechanical Engineer
description:
Overview & Responsibilities
PURPOSE OF THE JOB:
The Mechanical Engineer's function is to ensure proper mechanical package design & procurement for an ELLIOTT GROUP rotating equipment package. Package design includes electric motor with switchgears/VSDs/transformers, gear boxes (incl. Vorecon), API614 oil system(incl. rundown tank) , seal gas system(dry gas seal console per API614/692) , surface condensers, gland condensers, condensate pumps(API610) with steam turbines(per API611), sealing steam unit, steam/gas strainers/traps/non return valves(NRVs), oil accumulators, process PSVs/PCVs, gas coolers, air compressor inlet filters/blow off silencers, oil/water injection units, etc. for technical issues.
In addition to these technical role, the Mechanical Engineer's is also responsible for the project schedules, budget, time management and communication with internally with other ELLIOTT GROUP teams and external customers.
The purpose of the position is to hire more advanced engineering and leadership experience to an individual with equivalent experience to an ENGINEER I,II ,III or IV Mechanical Engineer. The position will function primarily as a Mechanical Engineer for package design to achieve equitable and satisfactory execution of contracts, within project budgets and to project schedules on projects of limited complexity.
The position can also function as a support element to a more senior engineering staff member, who is functioning as Lead Engineer on a large or complex project. In the support role, the position will provide the Lead Engineer, with assistance to achieve the same equitable and satisfactory execution of contracts, within project budgets and to project schedules.
The position will also be responsible to fulfil the following:* Maintain an environment of professional and ethical conduct within ELLIOTT GROUP.
* Follow department process work standards and procedures to achieve best-in-class contract execution as a member of Project Engineering.
* Interface between the Project Engineer, suppliers and customers both internal and external.
* Develop technical, project management, and commercial capabilities, to allow for personal development and career growth.
* Promote a positive attitude for a safe and healthy work environment, as well as awareness for high quality products and services from Project Engineering group.
* Provide input as requested for continuous improvement of ELLIOTT GROUP processes.
* Develop and demonstrate leadership within Project Engineering.
* Provide engineering support as required to Project Engineering


BACKGROUND and EXPERIENCE* Bachelor of Engineering / Technology, or equivalent four-year academic qualification.
Minimum of typically two (2) to eighteen (18) years of experience, as a Mechanical Design Engineer or Turbomachinery Auxiliaries System Design Engineer or equivalent work experience.


NATURE OF THE JOB* The Mechanical Engineer functions as the primary resource for technical design and coordination regarding turbomachinery auxiliary system and mechanical equipment of ELLIOTT Group Turbomachinery package.
* The Mechanical Engineer also functions as the primary technical contact for sub-suppliers of Mechanical and Fluid systems related components to achieve contract execution.
* The principle daily activities of this job involve collecting and analysing detailed technical information, and effectively communicating that information regarding the assigned project to the appropriate organization. Responding to new or unfamiliar complex situations is a common experience, however, guidance and direction from others will still be required. This position will expose the individual to direct customer contact.
* The nature of the job is designed to further build upon the foundation of knowledge gained as an ENGINEER I or II or III Mechanical Engineer, or from previous equivalent work experience. Training for the position will be aimed at self-development of specialization in technical areas and begin to develop organizational leadership skills.
* The individual will be encouraged to further develop their individual contribution to the Project Engineering departmental goals, to the extent that activities covered by established policies or standard procedures can be successfully managed.
* Expected travel is around 10-30% typically.
* Additional work hours or temporary schedule adjustment may be required.


CONTACT WITH OTHERS
Contact with the following occurs on a regular basis:* Manager of Project Engineering Group
* Project Engineers
* Project Managers
* Controls COE (Centre of Excellence)
* Product Engineering COE
* Purchasing COE
* Project COE
* Sales
* Applications
* Business Development
* Other Departments as required.
* Contact with the following, will be directly supervised initially and continuously monitored by Manager of Project Engineering
* Clients, Potential Clients, End users, or Purchasers.
* Engineering Contractors,
* Third Party Engineering Firms,
* Client's suppliers with which technical information must be exchanged.
* Any Regulatory Agency
* Communications and contact is expected to be of a strictly technical nature. Communications regarding commercial or contractual obligations should be addressed only under the direction of the Supervisor of Project Engineering, Manager Project
* Engineering, Project Manager, or another ELLIOTT senior staff member.


SUPERVISION
Direction of other's work efforts will be required such as direction to design staff, junior engineers, and document control staff.
The individual may be asked to provide direction to intern, rotational engineer, ENGINEER I - Mechanical Engineer, ENGINEER II - Mechanical Engineer, ENGINEER III - Mechanical Engineer positions as mentoring or project relationships as required.* Demonstrated leadership ability.
* Demonstrated ability to manage sub-suppliers.
* Demonstrated ability provide quality customer service and support.
* Exhibits desire for continuous improvement, continuous education, training, and personal development.
* Possesses good basic work habits, promptness, and dependability.
* Self-directed worker, with good work ethic.
* Disciplined, able to follow directions and procedures.
* Maintains a professional and business-like behavior.
* Good communications skills, verbal, and written with a demonstrated ability to interface across different cultural lines.
* Ability to travel (Local & International).
* Excellent computer skills regarding Word, Excel, and Power Point. Able to operate proficiently with ELLIOTT Business
* Systems, Project Management (PM), and Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) systems.
* Experience/Exposure to AutoCAD and 3D modelling software.
* Ability to learn quickly and adapt to a dynamic work environment.
* Developed time management skills, with an ability to balance demand among various projects.
* Preferred requirements: Turbo- machinery auxiliary systems, Mechanical Items and Equipment design engineering and procurement experience

  

SPECIFIC JOB RESPONSIBILITIES/COMPETENCIES
Continued building understanding of the ELLIOTT organization, its product lines, Project Engineering Group work procedures, and methods. The position requires the continued development in the area of Mechanical engineering with the expectation that the individual is to develop as a resource to the department in this area.* Continue building an understanding of industry related standards, such as API 612, 610, 614, 617, 670, 692, ASTM. Additionally, the position requires a sound understanding of other codes and standards frequently encountered in the petrochemical and oil and gas industries.
* Promote a positive attitude for a safe and healthy work environment, as well as awareness for high quality products and services from Project Engineering, in support of ELLIOTT GROUP management initiatives.
* Maintain an environment for professional and ethical conduct as directed by ELLIOTT corporate policies and ELLIOTT Code of Ethics.
* Review and analysis of customer specifications.
* Review, revision, and submittal of ELLIOTT GROUP internal design specification information.
* Creation of purchase requisitions for material procurement, including all supporting technical documentation
* Actively participate in Project Transfer Meetings (TM1 and TM2), manage transfer of project technical information from Proposal stage to Execution stage.
* Actively participate in key project meetings when required, including Kick Off Meeting (KOM), HAZOP meeting, Customer Coordination Meeting (CCM), Pre-Inspection Meeting (PIM) and Design Review Meetings (DRM).
* Facilitate major supplier meetings with client, and ELLIOTT personnel, including Kick Off Meeting (KOM), Customer
* Coordination Meeting (CCM), Pre-Inspection Meeting (PIM) and Design Review Meetings (DRM), with the assistance of the Project Manager.
* Correspondence, documents, and information to be submitted to the client for approval or record, through the Project Engineer.
* Provide due diligence in the retention of information sufficient to maintain adequate knowledge of the project for ‘downstream’ operations both internal and external to ELLIOTT GROUP.
* Ability to understand turbomachinery auxiliary systems and related equipment functionalities. Also, shall have ability procure same as external skids /items/equipment from external suppliers through purchase requisitions.
* Attend turbomachinery package 3D model reviews and provide technical assistance as Mechanical Engineer.
* Support and Lead in interpreting customer specifications and requisitioning components to meet those specifications.
* Full Mechanical design and procurement of Lube oil console as per API614 including equipment selection of Pump, Motors Filters, Accumulators, Rundown Tank, and Oil Mist Eliminator.
* Full Mechanical design and procurement of Dry Gas Seal Systems as per API692.


Review supplier documentation/calculations/ typical mechanical and general layouts drawings

title: Senior Sales Engineer
description:
### **Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity**


The position is a critical role for LSS India and is expected to play a significant role in the growth of LSS India over the span of the next 5 years. This position is responsible for program managing and the execution of portfolio for LSS India and execution of large projects at key customer sites. Role includes driving the execution of global BTI and NPIs in India along with the Field service manage / Field service engineers. Working with the customers and identify opportunities to position of BTI’s.


Drive cross-functional alignment to support customer sale and decision process, participating in sales pursuit strategy planning, executing product demos, assisting proposal team in right and fast commercial offerings, supporting customer negotiations, order fulfilment and hand-over to customer success team

  



**Key Responsibilities:**


* Own the growth deliverables of the LSS India business.


* Creating and converting opportunities for advance process software’s and other BTI portfolio.
* Forecasting numbers with growth projections


* Identifying market opportunities through meetings, networking and other channels


* Meeting existing and potential clients and building positive relationships


* Presentation to customer for BTI and NPI products.


* Creating a pipeline of opportunities for the various growth initiatives by working closely with the BTI and E4E leader as well as the sales team


* Help customers confidently understand product capabilities, product value and product integration within customer workflows and in direct support of customers strategic initiatives


**Key Capabilities:**


* Customers – Close to customers and ability to bring out the unmet customer needs


* Sales – works directly with sales team to drive execution of the growth portfolio and build a pipeline of opportunities


* Operations – coordinate for execution of projects/programs involving growth portfolio


* Must also have proven commercial awareness and acumen.


* Good and Clear Understanding of the Indian Market


* Ability to influence and communicate at all levels.


* Ability to clearly communicate thoughts and ideas


* Excellent interpersonal and communications skills with strong persuasion, influencing abilities and credible confident presence.


* Motivated self-starter who enjoys a dynamic environment and seeks the challenge of winning in a rapidly changing marketplace.


. In-depth knowledge of Honeywell and competitor offerings.

#### **Requisites:**

* 10-12 years’ experience
* Engineering graduate (preferable CS, ECE, instrumentation) or equivalent
* A mix of Execution, sales and marketing experience in the past.

 **Skills:**

* Ability to unearth key customer needs leading to product initiatives
* Strong and effective communication (English) & presentation skills
* Excellent program management skills. Ability to commercialize new products/solutions
* Excellent interpersonal skills
* Process oriented and strong analytical skills
* Solution provider and act with urgency attitude
* Ability to work cross-functionally and across geographies

#### **WE VALUE**

* Demonstrated ability to develop and foster strong customer relationships
* In-depth knowledge of Honeywell and competitor platforms, products and technologies
* Experience in technical writing and preparation of proposals
* Strong verbal and written communications skills
* Familiarity with industry regulatory requirements and future mandates
* Ability to achieve results through influence in a matrixed-team environment
* Ability to communicate effectively across language and cultural barriers

* **Category:** Sales Excellence and Support

title: Regional Sales Manager
description:
Job Description:
Axalta has remained at the forefront of the coatings industry by continually investing in innovative solutions. We engineer technologies that protect customers’ products – whether they are battling heat, light, corrosion, abrasion, moisture, or chemicals – and add dimension and beauty with colourful finishes. We have a vast and ever-evolving portfolio of brands primed to play an important part in everything from modernizing infrastructure around the world to enabling the next generation of electric and autonomous vehicles.
We are currently looking for a Area Sales Manager to join us and achieving sales and collection targets for Automotive Refinish Paints in Uttar Pradesh.
Key responsibilities:
1. Achieve assigned sales and collection targets  

2. Manage distributor and dealer network, including network expansion.  

3. Further develop business in the area by winning new B Class bodyshop  

 accounts.  

4. Manage service requirements of body shops and key customers in the area.  

5. Planning & Forecasting  

6. Managing Team of Sales & technical (including contract)  

7. Maintain relationship with  

8. Responsible for IDS & DSO  

9. Responsible for over all business development in defined area.  

10. Taking lead in identifying and developing new business opportunities
Key requirements:
MBA / Degree in paint technology/ Chemical Engineering, He should have to 8 to 10 years of experience in Sales role. Should have exposure in industry like Paint (Refinish), Tyre, Lubricants, Automobile. Should be able to cover large area. Area: - Entire UP excluding NCR.
Axalta operates its business in two segments: Performance Coatings and Mobility Coatings, which serve four end markets, including Refinish, Industrial, Light Vehicle and Commercial Vehicle, across North America, EMEA, Latin America and Asia-Pacific. Our diverse global footprint allows us to deliver solutions in over 140+ countries and coat 30 million vehicles per year. We’ve recently set an exciting 2040 carbon neutrality goal, in addition to 10 other sustainability initiatives, and we take pride in working with our customers to optimize their businesses and achieve their goals.
Our Company:
Axalta has remained at the forefront of the coatings industry by continually investing in innovative solutions. We engineer technologies that protect customers’ products – whether they are battling heat, light, corrosion, abrasion, moisture, or chemicals – and add dimension and beauty with colorful finishes. We have a vast and ever-evolving portfolio of brands primed to play an important part in everything from modernizing infrastructure around the world to enabling the next generation of electric and autonomous vehicles.  

Axalta operates its business in two segments: Performance Coatings and Mobility Coatings, which serve four end markets, including Refinish, Industrial, Light Vehicle and Commercial Vehicle, across North America, EMEA, Latin America and Asia-Pacific. Our diverse global footprint allows us to deliver solutions in over 140+ countries and coat 30 million vehicles per year. We’ve recently set an exciting 2040 carbon neutrality goal, in addition to 10 other sustainability initiatives, and we take pride in working with our customers to optimize their businesses and achieve their goals.

title: Technical Support Engineer
description:
**About Avaya**
---------------



Businesses are built by the experiences they provide, and every day, millions of those experiences are delivered by Avaya. Organizations trust Avaya to provide innovative solutions for some of their most important ambitions and challenges, giving them the freedom to engage their customers and employees in ways that deliver the greatest business benefits.



Avaya contact center and communications solutions help power immersive, personalized, and unforgettable customer experiences that drive business momentum. With the freedom to choose their journey, there’s no limit to the experiences Avaya customers can create.



The richness of Avaya’s global team diversity is our greatest strength, and we are committed to being a workplace where authenticity and individuality are celebrated and different perspectives are embraced. Learn more at www.avaya.com.

Job Code: 00255941


Job Family: Services

An individual contributor who provides remote post-sales support of software and/or hardware systems, sub-systems and/or applications for customers or field personnel utilizing telephone and remote diagnostic capabilities. Includes supporting 3rd party products and occasional on-site support. Analyzes symptoms, logs, and data required to resolve issues of medium complexity.
